story:
[Italian and English version]

Con l'espressione water grabbing, o "accaparramento dell'acqua", ci si riferisce a situazioni in cui attori potenti sono in grado di prendere il controllo o deviare a proprio vantaggio risorse idriche preziose, sottraendole a comunità locali o intere nazioni, la cui sussistenza si basa proprio su quelle stesse risorse e quegli stessi ecosistemi che vengono depredati.

Famiglie scacciate dai loro villaggi per fare spazio a mega dighe, privatizzazione delle fonti idriche, inquinamento dell’acqua per scopi industriali di cui beneficiano in pochi e danneggiano l’intero ecosistema. Nel cosiddetto sud nel mondo ma anche in alcuni paesi industrializzati, da bene comune liberamente accessibile l’acqua si trasforma in bene privato o controllato da chi detiene il potere. Sotto la spinta della crescente domanda d’acqua dovuta all’ aumento della popolazione e alla crescita industriale dei paesi in via di sviluppo e sotto la morsa del cambiamento climatico, sempre più visibile nella nostra quotidianità l’acqua diventa fonte di conflitto, bene scarso per cui è fondamentale accaparrarsene,  a spese del vicino.
________________________________________________________________________

Water grabbing or “water hoarding” refers to a situation in which powerful actors, public or private, are able to take control of or reallocate precious water resources for their own benefit, at the expense of local communities and ecosystems on which the communities’ livelihoods are based. Families driven from their villages to make room for mega dams, privatization of water sources, water pollution from industrial purposes that benefit few and harm the entire ecosystem. In what some call the world’s south, but also in some industrialized countries, water is transformed from a freely accessible common good to a private good controlled by those in power. Pressure mounts as the demand for water continues to grow because of increasing population, industrial growth in developing countries and the grip of climate change over our daily lives. Water is becoming a source of conflict and a scarce commodity that those in power hoard, even at the expense of others close by.

COME DENUNCIARE QUESTO FENOMENO?

Un pool di giornalisti (Emanuele Bompan), fotografi (Gianluca Cecere, Thomas Cristofoletti, Fausto Podavini), cartografi (Federica Fragapane e Riccardo Pravettoni) e ricercatori (Marirosa Iannelli, Università di Genova), ha iniziato a lavorare da 10 mesi su questo tema per mostrare a cittadini e policy maker come l’acqua e il watergrabbing stiano diventando i driver di nuovi conflitti e di ingiustizia diffusa. Grazie al Centro di Giornalismo Europeo (EJC) siamo riusciti a realizzare una parte di questo lavoro. Per completarlo vogliamo trovare sufficienti risorse economiche corrispondenti a quanto ricevuto.

In questo modo potremo completare uno dei più grandi lavori mai realizzati a livello globale sul topic del water grabbing e abbiamo proprio bisogno del tuo aiuto per avviare un’inchiesta ambientale in Brasile e in India, due Paesi fortemente impattati dalla privatizzazione e dai cambiamenti climatici. Il progetto water grabbing crescerà in modo da creare un impatto reale, rilanciando il tema del Diritto all’ Acqua, nel dibattito pubblico e anche politico, con presentazioni mirate alla Camera dei Deputati, agli uffici preposti dell’ONU e al Ministero degli Affari Esteri. Dal punto di vista educativo il progetto sarà quindi portato in scuole e università per raccontare, grazie anche all’ ausilio delle mappe e delle infografiche, la questione idrica e i suoi legami con economia, agricoltura, sanità e cambiamento climatico.
__________________________________________________________________________

HOW TO DENOUNCE THIS?

A group of journalists (Emanuele Bompan), photographers (Gianluca Cecere, Thomas Cristofoletti, Fausto Podavini), cartographers (Federica Fragapane and Riccardo Pravettoni) and researchers (Marirosa Iannelli, University of Genoa), are working on a project to show citizens and policy makers how water and water grabbing are becoming the drivers behind new conflicts and widespread injustice.

Thanks to the European Journalism Center (EJC), we were able to realize a part of this project. To complete it, we aim to find financing to match what we have already received.

With this, we can complete one of the greatest projects ever realized on a global level on the topic of water grabbing. For this we need your support to investigate watergrabbing in India and Brazil, two countries heavily affected by privatization and climate change. The project will create a true impact and will raise the issue of the Right to Water in public debate as well as in the political sphere with targeted presentations to the Chamber of Deputies, to United Nations offices and to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From an educational point of view, the project will also be brought to schools and universities to talk about the water issue, using maps and infographics, and to show the issue’s critical connections.

I RISULTATI

I risultati di questo progetto multidisciplinare confluiranno in un libro (edito in italiano e inglese), un nuovo speciale giornalistico, un catalogo fotografico, un atlante cartografico, infografiche e contributi  tematici, e una mostra fotografica itinerante.
_________________________________________________________________________

THE RESULTS 

The results of this multidisciplinary team project will be published in a book (in Italian and English), a photo catalogue, a cartographic atlas, a special journalistic feature, and a traveling exhibition with photos, infographics and special contributions. The goal is to reach as broad of an audience as possible with a wide-ranging investigative project – the kind that newspapers today no longer have the resources to support.

UNA BATTAGLIA PER IL DIRITTO ALL'ACQUA

Questo progetto vuole garantire il TUO diritto all’ acqua. Siamo fortemente convinti che l’inchiesta ambientale può e dovrebbe crescere ulteriormente per documentare sempre più ingiustizie, nuovi conflitti idrici e nuove storie. Vorremo anche rendere più tangibile riuscendo a pubblicare molte copie dei prodotti di documentazione, così che anche coloro che ci supportano possano toccare con mano e diffondere i testi, le foto e l’atlante fotografico.

Ti chiediamo di supportare Watergrabbing, a story of water. Perché il diritto all’ acqua è il futuro del Pianeta.
__________________________________________________________________________

FIGHT FOR THE RIGHT TO WATER

This project will work to ensure YOUR right to water. We strongly believe that the report can and should grow further to document new injustices, new conflicts and new stories. We also want to make the project tangible by publishing hard copies, so that you can hold the texts, the photos, and the atlas in your hands.

We ask you to support Watergrabbing - A story of Water. Because the right to water is the future of the planet.

COME PUOI SUPPORTARE IL PROGETTO CONCRETAMENTE?

Puoi aiutare il progetto water grabbing acquistando i prodotti editoriali (il libro, l’atlante e le foto) che usciranno durante tutta la durata del progetto. Potrai sempre monitorare la crescita del progetto, condividere e diffondere i vari prodotti editoriali per assicurare sempre una adeguata visibilità su tematiche importanti come le ingiustizie sociali e ambientali, ciò che ci spinge sempre a scrivere e raccontare nuove storie.

Abbiamo già esaminato 3 Paesi. Ma crediamo che per alimentare una prospettiva più ampia e complessa, abbiamo davvero bisogno di continuare le indagini sull’ accaparramento idrico nel mondo. Paesi come il Brasile e l’India non sono semplici da visitare e documentare,  abbiamo però un’esperienza di lunga durata, ci occupiamo di giornalismo ambientale da oltre 10 anni, abbiamo una grande squadra di cartografi e infografici che collaborano con editori internazionali e con l’agenzia dell Nazioni Unite.

Abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere questo importate obiettivo di raccolta fondi per non compromettere la ricerca e la denuncia ambientale.

E’ per questo che abbiamo bisogno di TE!
__________________________________________________________________________

HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT THE PROJECT?

You can help by buying the editorial products (books, atlas and photos) that will be the outcome of the project, once fully completed. The proceeds will be used to grow and complete the Watergrabbing project so that it can monitor developments on a global scale, and ensure visibility for important issues of social and environmental injustice, while allowing us to produce two new stories.

We have come to a great length, having already surveyed three countries. But we believe to give a better and more complex perspective we need to continue the investigation.
Country like Brazil and India aren't easy to report from. But We have a long term expertise, we have been doing environmental journalism for over ten year, we have a great cartographic and infographic team who as been working for UN Agencies and international newspaper. Not reaching the goal might compromise the project. We cannot allow this to happen.

That's why we need you!
story_txt: [Italian and English version]Con l'espressione water grabbing, o "accaparramento dell'acqua", ci si riferisce a situazioni in cui attori potenti sono in grado di prendere il controllo o deviare a proprio vantaggio risorse idriche preziose, sottraendole a comunità locali o intere nazioni, la cui sussistenza si basa proprio su quelle stesse risorse e quegli stessi ecosistemi che vengono depredati.Famiglie scacciate dai loro villaggi per fare spazio a mega dighe, privatizzazione delle fonti idriche, inquinamento dell’acqua per scopi industriali di cui beneficiano in pochi e danneggiano l’intero ecosistema. Nel cosiddetto sud nel mondo ma anche in alcuni paesi industrializzati, da bene comune liberamente accessibile l’acqua si trasforma in bene privato o controllato da chi detiene il potere. Sotto la spinta della crescente domanda d’acqua dovuta all’ aumento della popolazione e alla crescita industriale dei paesi in via di sviluppo e sotto la morsa del cambiamento climatico, sempre più visibile nella nostra quotidianità l’acqua diventa fonte di conflitto, bene scarso per cui è fondamentale accaparrarsene,  a spese del vicino.________________________________________________________________________Water grabbing or “water hoarding” refers to a situation in which powerful actors, public or private, are able to take control of or reallocate precious water resources for their own benefit, at the expense of local communities and ecosystems on which the communities’ livelihoods are based. Families driven from their villages to make room for mega dams, privatization of water sources, water pollution from industrial purposes that benefit few and harm the entire ecosystem. In what some call the world’s south, but also in some industrialized countries, water is transformed from a freely accessible common good to a private good controlled by those in power. Pressure mounts as the demand for water continues to grow because of increasing population, industrial growth in developing countries and the grip of climate change over our daily lives. Water is becoming a source of conflict and a scarce commodity that those in power hoard, even at the expense of others close by.COME DENUNCIARE QUESTO FENOMENO?Un pool di giornalisti (Emanuele Bompan), fotografi (Gianluca Cecere, Thomas Cristofoletti, Fausto Podavini), cartografi (Federica Fragapane e Riccardo Pravettoni) e ricercatori (Marirosa Iannelli, Università di Genova), ha iniziato a lavorare da 10 mesi su questo tema per mostrare a cittadini e policy maker come l’acqua e il watergrabbing stiano diventando i driver di nuovi conflitti e di ingiustizia diffusa. Grazie al Centro di Giornalismo Europeo (EJC) siamo riusciti a realizzare una parte di questo lavoro. Per completarlo vogliamo trovare sufficienti risorse economiche corrispondenti a quanto ricevuto.In questo modo potremo completare uno dei più grandi lavori mai realizzati a livello globale sul topic del water grabbing e abbiamo proprio bisogno del tuo aiuto per avviare un’inchiesta ambientale in Brasile e in India, due Paesi fortemente impattati dalla privatizzazione e dai cambiamenti climatici. Il progetto water grabbing crescerà in modo da creare un impatto reale, rilanciando il tema del Diritto all’ Acqua, nel dibattito pubblico e anche politico, con presentazioni mirate alla Camera dei Deputati, agli uffici preposti dell’ONU e al Ministero degli Affari Esteri. Dal punto di vista educativo il progetto sarà quindi portato in scuole e università per raccontare, grazie anche all’ ausilio delle mappe e delle infografiche, la questione idrica e i suoi legami con economia, agricoltura, sanità e cambiamento climatico.__________________________________________________________________________HOW TO DENOUNCE THIS?A group of journalists (Emanuele Bompan), photographers (Gianluca Cecere, Thomas Cristofoletti, Fausto Podavini), cartographers (Federica Fragapane and Riccardo Pravettoni) and researchers (Marirosa Iannelli, University of Genoa), are working on a project to show citizens and policy makers how water and water grabbing are becoming the drivers behind new conflicts and widespread injustice.Thanks to the European Journalism Center (EJC), we were able to realize a part of this project. To complete it, we aim to find financing to match what we have already received.With this, we can complete one of the greatest projects ever realized on a global level on the topic of water grabbing. For this we need your support to investigate watergrabbing in India and Brazil, two countries heavily affected by privatization and climate change. The project will create a true impact and will raise the issue of the Right to Water in public debate as well as in the political sphere with targeted presentations to the Chamber of Deputies, to United Nations offices and to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. From an educational point of view, the project will also be brought to schools and universities to talk about the water issue, using maps and infographics, and to show the issue’s critical connections.I RISULTATII risultati di questo progetto multidisciplinare confluiranno in un libro (edito in italiano e inglese), un nuovo speciale giornalistico, un catalogo fotografico, un atlante cartografico, infografiche e contributi  tematici, e una mostra fotografica itinerante._________________________________________________________________________THE RESULTS The results of this multidisciplinary team project will be published in a book (in Italian and English), a photo catalogue, a cartographic atlas, a special journalistic feature, and a traveling exhibition with photos, infographics and special contributions. The goal is to reach as broad of an audience as possible with a wide-ranging investigative project – the kind that newspapers today no longer have the resources to support.UNA BATTAGLIA PER IL DIRITTO ALL'ACQUAQuesto progetto vuole garantire il TUO diritto all’ acqua. Siamo fortemente convinti che l’inchiesta ambientale può e dovrebbe crescere ulteriormente per documentare sempre più ingiustizie, nuovi conflitti idrici e nuove storie. Vorremo anche rendere più tangibile riuscendo a pubblicare molte copie dei prodotti di documentazione, così che anche coloro che ci supportano possano toccare con mano e diffondere i testi, le foto e l’atlante fotografico.Ti chiediamo di supportare Watergrabbing, a story of water. Perché il diritto all’ acqua è il futuro del Pianeta.__________________________________________________________________________FIGHT FOR THE RIGHT TO WATERThis project will work to ensure YOUR right to water. We strongly believe that the report can and should grow further to document new injustices, new conflicts and new stories. We also want to make the project tangible by publishing hard copies, so that you can hold the texts, the photos, and the atlas in your hands.We ask you to support Watergrabbing - A story of Water. Because the right to water is the future of the planet.COME PUOI SUPPORTARE IL PROGETTO CONCRETAMENTE?Puoi aiutare il progetto water grabbing acquistando i prodotti editoriali (il libro, l’atlante e le foto) che usciranno durante tutta la durata del progetto. Potrai sempre monitorare la crescita del progetto, condividere e diffondere i vari prodotti editoriali per assicurare sempre una adeguata visibilità su tematiche importanti come le ingiustizie sociali e ambientali, ciò che ci spinge sempre a scrivere e raccontare nuove storie.Abbiamo già esaminato 3 Paesi. Ma crediamo che per alimentare una prospettiva più ampia e complessa, abbiamo davvero bisogno di continuare le indagini sull’ accaparramento idrico nel mondo. Paesi come il Brasile e l’India non sono semplici da visitare e documentare,  abbiamo però un’esperienza di lunga durata, ci occupiamo di giornalismo ambientale da oltre 10 anni, abbiamo una grande squadra di cartografi e infografici che collaborano con editori internazionali e con l’agenzia dell Nazioni Unite.Abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere questo importate obiettivo di raccolta fondi per non compromettere la ricerca e la denuncia ambientale.E’ per questo che abbiamo bisogno di TE!__________________________________________________________________________HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT THE PROJECT?You can help by buying the editorial products (books, atlas and photos) that will be the outcome of the project, once fully completed. The proceeds will be used to grow and complete the Watergrabbing project so that it can monitor developments on a global scale, and ensure visibility for important issues of social and environmental injustice, while allowing us to produce two new stories.We have come to a great length, having already surveyed three countries. But we believe to give a better and more complex perspective we need to continue the investigation.Country like Brazil and India aren't easy to report from. But We have a long term expertise, we have been doing environmental journalism for over ten year, we have a great cartographic and infographic team who as been working for UN Agencies and international newspaper. Not reaching the goal might compromise the project. We cannot allow this to happen.That's why we need you!

story:
With Dance for Equality of Gender and Races

My background

With Croatian origins but born in Switzerland, I am living with people from different cultures my whole life. I travelled throughout Europe, India, Cuba… and I dance since childhood. Furthermore, my father is an internationally recognised sexologist and meditation teacher. By growing up in a spiritually and socially very engaged family I realised that, to change the society we have to change ourselves first.

This summer (08/17) I will successfully finish my two bachelors in Indology and Pedagogy. Through many different dance styles, schools and dance pedagogues I have learnt a lot about diversity in dance. Now I am passing this knowledge to my own dance group Só Dança. In 2014 I have invented an “Afrolatin” course for the sports program of the University of Zagreb and was leading it for six semesters (until March 2017). The program is continued under the guidance of my student and successor Silvija Musić.

Throughout the years I have learnt that when we dance, we are all equal. Everyone surrendering to the rhythm and movement gets into some kind of flow. There is no place or time for hate, aggression, discrimination. No one is thinking if the dancer beside is a woman or a man, or if they have a different skin-colour. We are just one shining, vibrant heart!

For this reason I called my dance group Só Dança which in Portuguese means “Only dance”.

 

Project

I will open a mobile institute/organisation whose main work will be the organisation of festivals, which will promote two main life-goals: equality of gender and equality of races.

I mainly dance Bollywood (India), African (modern and traditional) and Latin-American dances (couple-dances like Salsa, Bachata, as well as Reggaeton, Samba, Brasil funk). In the beginning, using these styles, I want to bring the Indian, African and Latin-American culture closer to the European and vice versa (and later include also all other world cultures). To get deeper knowledge of contemporary dance as well as of other dances, starting in January 2018 I will apply to diverse dance-academy’s in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, the Netherlands… From October on I will work 8 months in Zürich, Switzerland to earn some money and at the same time prepare myself for all those auditions.

It is exactly through dance that we can meet and understand each other better because every culture is expressing through dance its ethnic values and soul contents. Expressing what for them is most important.

When the project (institute) gets alive I want to expand it on all other cultures worldwide and invite guest dancers with cultural and psychological knowledge. Just as well I want to create a positive climate between women and men, with emphasis on gender equality. Love and harmony between genders is my wish and my vision. At the age of 16 I was acting in Medulin, Croatia, in the Vagina Monologue play, written by Eve Ensler. At the age of 18 (2013) I organised for the first time in Pula, Croatia, the One Billion Rising (OBR) protest. OBR is a dance flash mob against violence on women (invented by Eve Ensler). I organised this event for three consecutive years in Pula (see more: link). Related to that, I held also a presentation about violence on women for elucidation (germ. Aufklärung) of the students of the Gymnasium of Pula. Furthermore, during my studies I have held diverse seminars about feminism and gender equality. Occasionally I translate books with Aufklärung and sexuality issues.

You, Supporters, are helping me to make this vision become reality! Your financial support will help me to work and at the same time to devote myself completely to the realisation of our common vision: equality of gender and races. (Teaching, organising small projects and starting with preparations for the first Só Dança festival.)

 

What I give & what I get

What I give:

  • dance classes and shows
  • scientific lectures
  • cultural workshops

Through dance, every folk is expressing its values, soul content, tradition, that’s exactly the reason why you can get to know each other (cultures) better through dance.

Today in a world full of problems with the integration of immigrants and asylum seekers and also problems concerning gender equality the Só Dança institute will be a new way where we will learn about people who are different from us, hear their stories and make friends with them through the medium of dance. Also learn to understand the other sex, try to see from his or her perspective and make peace between each other. A new way to understand mankind.

Só Dança will be a mobile institute, which will travel around Europe (and wider) and organise festivals with different cultures and gender issues as their main topic. The central medium for learning and understanding will be dance.  However, there will be also scientific lectures held by sociologists, sexologists, anthropologists and others as well as small cultural workshops (for example production of traditional African food and jewellery, how to wear a saree, I as a woman - I as a man, gender workshops with refugee women etc.).

The institute will organise festivals but also collaborate with similar organisations and give workshops for them.

To read more about dance classes scroll down.

By presenting cultures to each other, Só Dança will take care of traditions and emphasise the traditional version of a dance, along with encouraging creativity. It should be clear how a dance traditionally looks like but we want to free dancers minds too. There is no right and wrong when you dance. There is no “it has to be like that” when you dance. I want to create a dance-world free of prejudices, free of rules. Inspire dancers to think outside the “how-it’s-supposed-to-be box”, design your own language, combine different dance-styles: for example use Hip Hop and contemporary while dancing Salsa and so on.

 

What I get - financial support for:

  • dance education
  • preparations and establishing of the Só Dança institute/organisation

With financial help during my work in Switzerland I can continue with my previous activities and dedicate my full time and energy for the establishing of the institute and organising a first festival (in Summer 2018), which will embody the ideas of Só Dança.

1. Life support (per month)
200 EUR rental fee
400 EUR food
100 EUR public transport
500 EUR dance classes 5days a week
100 EUR pocket money

TOTAL: 1300 EUR x 8 months = 10’400 EUR

2. Establishing of the institute/first festival support
For the establishing of the institute and the organisation of a first festival I will need about – 50 000 EUR depending on how big the festival will be, how many guests teachers and cultural workshops I will have and so on.
7000 EUR hall rental
5000 EUR flights and accommodation of artists/professors
4000 EUR drinks and catering team
2000 EUR photographers and camera-men
2000 EUR technical equipment team
14’000 EUR promo company
Etc.
 

What happens if I don't reach my funding-goal?

The project will be realised sooner or later. I am here, my team is here, the idea is here and we are already working on the project. Só Dança is and will happen. Let us work together for a better world! Help us to work immediately!

 

Who will attend the festivals?

Everyone. Youth, adults, dancers and non-dancers.

The festivals will be open for everyone above 16. There will always be dance classes for different levels: beginner, medium, advanced.

 

Why is my project important for you, supporters, and the world?

All of us want to live in a peaceful and joyful world. Nowadays we are far away from these ideals. It is enough to mention the problems with ISIS, hate against Moslems, problems with refugees and their integration into the European countries, or the prejudices and more or less hidden discrimination towards Africans, Asians and all other “strangers“ who come to our countries. And the problem of the non-equal rights between men and women, which is present the most of the time in human history in all nations and cultures.

In this world full of ignorance, intolerance, lack of love, compassion and knowledge, we need more projects like With Dance for Equality of Gender and Races, who will, in a peaceful, educative and amusing way, get people more close to each other and let them lively experience our unity in diversity. Make them understand that we can live all together despite all the differences. Let them live together for those few moments. It will open their minds and hearts.

 

Some more reasons why to support us:

  • for some people it is easier to learn through practical experience and not only lectures, that’s why I want to use dance as a medium of learning
  • for people who don’t have the possibility to travel and meet other cultures in that way, Só Dança would bring other cultures to them
  • every religion says the same: we should be good people and help each other

 

We need Só Dança, everyone dancing together in the rhythm of mother Earth’s heartbeat!

 

Similar projects which I already realised

All that is already existing in my life and, as I already mentioned above, I had some other projects, where Só Dança’s vision was making the first steps in this world:

  1. I was the initiator, main organiser and dancer of the first One Billion Rising protest against violence on women in Pula, Croatia (see more: link)) from 2013-2015
  2. I held a presentation about violence on women for elucidation (germ. Aufklärung) of students of the Gymnasium of Pula
  3. During my studies I held diverse seminars about feminism and gender equality
  4. In 2014 I invented the “Afrolatin” course in the sports program of the University of Zagreb and was leading it for three school-years (since march 2017, the program is continued under the guidance of my student and successor Silvija Musić)
  5. In 2014 I founded my own dance group Só Dança with which I perform on diverse dance-events in whole Croatia as well as abroad; several performances on cultural-events for the Indian Embassy in Zagreb, Department of Indology and Far Eastern Studies, Zagreb etc.

 

Ideas for dance classes:

  • Different dance styles with historical background stories
  • couple-dances with switching roles,
  • ladies styling to free the woman’s passion, make them feel beautiful in their bodies, make them love their bodies and show their passion and femaleness through dance
  • also for men – breaking prejudices about men who can’t move
  • girls dancing with girls, men with men

We want to create a network of people in whole Europe (and wider), so that this festival becomes something stable and after some time we would open institutes in other countries. Also create a program for primary and secondary schools, also universities where already children would learn about different cultures and dance from small on, dance also with the other sex, learn that we are different and love the difference.

 

Why me?

  1. People say that I have charisma and positive influence on people
  2. I already do and live all what I explained above and I am determined to continue doing it in a more professional and sophisticated way, in order to spread my message and my method to wider audiences
  3. I am raised in a multicultural family as also in multicultural surroundings

 

Other ways to help

  1. Share our project on social media and call on people who maybe could help also financially
  2. If you know other ways than Facebook/website/direct e-mails to share and promote our project – please give us suggestions!
  3. Send us suggestions of people/institutions who could be interested in our project
  4. New ideas, inputs – just write us J
  5. Please recommend us to potentially influential people/institutions

 

Só Dança team:

Petra Market https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NzbvmpTeS7U&feature=youtu.be

Also create a program for primary and secondary schools, also universities where already children would learn about different cultures and dance from small on, dance also with the other sex, learn that we are different and love the difference.
 
Why me?

People say that I have charisma and positive influence on people
I already do and live all what I explained above and I am determined to continue doing it in a more professional and sophisticated way, in order to spread my message and my method to wider audiences
I am raised in a multicultural family as also in multicultural surroundings

 
Other ways to help


Share our project on social media and call on people who maybe could help also financially
If you know other ways than Facebook/website/direct e-mails to share and promote our project – please give us suggestions!
Send us suggestions of people/institutions who could be interested in our project
New ideas, inputs – just write us J
Please recommend us to potentially influential people/institutions


 
Só Dança team:
Petra Market https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NzbvmpTeS7U&feature=youtu.be

story:
Who are you? What is this?

If you're reading this, chances are you already know me. I'm Mel (or Gracie), I'm a rape survivor, and I'm a compulsive helper. This is my photo project; it's also my healing project. I'd like it to be even more than that. I believe it can be bigger, reach more people, build better community. I need you to help me get there and I have faith that we can do it.

Almost half a year ago, now, I was talking to my therapist and I mentioned how, even as I have worked so hard to do what it takes to recover from the trauma of sexual assault, there are questions in my head that can still pop up and ground me in my tracks. "Why didn't you just wear something else?" "Are you sure that's what happened?" "Why didn't you tell someone sooner?" It doesn't matter where I am or how well I am doing, as soon as one of these doubts comes up, everything starts to crumble a little. She asked me where those questions came from. I told her they came from me. She refused to accept that as an answer, so I did some hard thinking and realized: they came from some of the first people I talked to about my rape.

I knew I wasn't the only one. I knew I had to do something with this.

With experience as an art nude and shibari model, I had a pretty good idea of what my approach would be. Self bondage, self portraits, body writing. I wanted to create a visual metaphor for the way that these doubts kept binding me back to my assault, kept me from finding whole healing. I picked up a secondhand camera and set up a studio space in the basement. On a whim, I reached out and asked if anyone else could remember things people had said to imply that they were wholly or partially responsible for their sexual assault. The response was enormous.

I cannot be more grateful to everyone who shared their stories with me. Your vulnerability is what made this important. Your gift is what made this a reality.

Now I have several dozen images, two social media accounts, and a thirst to make a real difference. That's where you, the sponsors and contributors, come in.

Prints, Magnets, and Guerrilla Book Drops

I've set the goal for this campaign intentionally low. I don't have a minimum dollar amount in order to ensure production. Indiegogo's "flexible funding" structure means that every. single. dollar. helps this weird little windmill-tilting campaign gain more ground. Off the top, 50% of every dollar goes to The Date Safe Project (www.datesafeproject.org), an organization based right here in Milwaukee that teaches consent and positive sexual decision making to youth and adults across the country. This means if the campaign raises $700, I write a $350 check to The Date Safe Project. Any fees paid to Indiegogo, Paypal, or banks come out of my half of that $700. And after those fees, the money goes to three places:

  • To cover the costs of perks: printing, shipping, et cetera.
  • To recoup some of the investments already dedicated to the Unbind Me work: my cheap camera, my weird Home Depot work lights, hours and evenings spent trapped in the basement, and lots and lots of makeup removal wipes. (It turns out that when your eyeliner says "waterproof", it means it and you're going to have to scrub like heck to get the words off your body between shoots.)
  • To reinvest in the project: Hitting my $1000 goal means that I can print books. They will be made available as perks, but also, they will be ordered in bulk and carried around in my purse. They will be left at galleries and popup shows, free to whoever needs to see this work and read some encouragement. They will be strewn around cities to make rape culture regulars uncomfortable and to (maybe, hopefully) show them exactly how it feels to be tied back to one of the worst moments in your life when all you want is to heal and move on. My plans are small to start with, but big after that.

My Only Limit Is Your Generosity. My Only Strength Is Your Generosity.

I am coming to you with open hands. The minimum contribution for this campaign is $3, and just that $3 makes a real difference. If Indiegogo had a "give any amount" perk option, I'd use it. This whole project is an experiment, a question, and the answer is in your hands.

Do we dare to show the rape culture public exactly how victim blaming blocks the path to healing and justice?

Are we willing to put our necks and hearts on the line to make sure that at least one person doesn't have to face the doubts assault survivors hear every day?

Can we give one dollar more in the hope that we reach one more mind?

Art is here to "comfort the afflicted and afflict the comfortable". Let's blow some boundaries.

Your Words Are As Important As Your Wallet

If you're not in a position to contribute, that is fine! You can still lend your force to this movement. Share the campaign. Tell your stories. Spread the word. If you know me well you probably also know I am not the most adept with social media. I am depending on my circle of smart, kind, incredibly talented friends to spread this campaign. Make a lot of noise, loves. I know you're good at it.

With gratitude and humility,
Melody Nugent/Gracie Oh

story:
She interrupts is more than a fundraiser. We're opening our magic box of interrupting tools - mentoring, networking, and training - to the public. By buying one of our exclusive services or campaign items, you're supporting women all over the world who we all need to have a mic in their hands. This is how we persist. This is how we interrupt. 

What is this campaign about? 

Increasing diverse voices in policy discussions and the media through FPI's tailored services.

Through this limited campaign, we're opening our magic box of workshops, networking opportunities, and seminars to the public. You might be an area expert in Asia, Africa, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East or nuclear security, drones, trade policy; you might be focused on finance, global health, or education; you might work in law, business, national security, entrepreneurship - whatever your focus or expertise, if you are eager to develop your voice, get published, and participate in high-level discussions, our tailored training is for you and your squad.

Your support -- whether it be through your rocking a limited edition FPI shirt or signing up for one of our workshops -- will help FPI expand its mentoring and leadership training; help us build other opportunities to help support diverse voices; help keep the pressure on the media to ensure gender parity. 

 

Here's the challenge: 

 

For the past three years, we've held four fellowship cycles with 19 fellows. We've mentored hundreds more. 

But if the past year has shown us anything, it's that we need to double down in our efforts to expand access and opportunity for women and those on the margins. We're on track to scale up FPI - to spread our knowledge and network far and wide. New America and the European Journalism Centre have backed us. We've been up to West Point and we've been over to Istanbul. Now we want to come to you, wherever you are. 

We need all hands on deck. The She Interrupts campaign isn't just about diversity for the sake of diversity. It's about tackling modern history's most complex issues.

 

What we're offering:

We've got a number of limited editions items - the #ShePersisted series designed by FPI ally and Helsinki-based illustrator Elina Tuomi.

She reached out to us a few months ago, offering her beautiful art as a gift to the resistance. At a difficult time, she took our broken hearts and made them into art (and we made them into totes, posters, and stickers) with a beautiful vision board of inspiring interruptors. These women got in formation long before Bey sounded her battle cry. Let's follow suit. 

 

 

 

About that magic box -- below is a menu of services you can purchase for the first time in FPI's history. We're offering different workshops and seminars to bring you to the next level of impact. By purchasing them, you're buying into a model that helps hundreds of women around the world gain the access they deserve, free of charge. 

 

Half-day workshop - Introduction to Interrupting

  • This in-person half-day workshop is an introduction to interrupting your own mindset (and, eventually, the media).
    • We start off with an assessment on (1) understanding your own strengths and challenges and (2) what is an “expert." In the next hour we go through understanding unconscious bias in society as well as in ourselves; understanding the media landscape, including dispelling myths about who is “qualified” to be on the op-ed page and an on-air pundit. Afterwards, the group will engage in a role play. In the final hour, participants will prepare an outline of her expertise and a pitch to an editor.
  • We will offer this half-day workshop in New York and Washington D.C.

Customized seminars (three tiers):

  • Start with you: Building the ground floor
    • You have lots of goals. Where do you start? This hour-long online seminar will help you understand your strengths and challenges. We'll lay out a plan to build on your goals and help you move forward. It is specifically designed for recent college grads.
  • ​Moving beyond the first rung of the career ladder
    • You scored your first job. Where do you go from here? It’s never too early to navigate your career. This hour-long online seminar will help you start building a career path and own your awesomeness. It is designed for those starting out, for those budding into interruptor extraordinaires.
  • Mid-career opportunities: Moving from good to great
    • You've mastered the basics and moved up. You're "senior" or an "expert," but feel stuck. How do you navigate a career midway through? How do you continue to grow, challenge yourself, and write that book? And how the heck do you get on CNN or Charlie Rose's show? This hour-long seminar will help those who are navigating that sacred middle, eager to take their power to the next level. 

FPI's Premier Fellowship Program:

How do you pitch an editor? What are the do's and don'ts of public presentations? How do you build a personal brand? FPI's Fellowship Program tackles: media training, confidence building, sharpening your brand, and honing leadership skills. Above all, it is a home for you -- a space for you to flourish, a community to lean on as you ‘lean in.'

FPI is your trampoline in changing the ratio. The FPI online flagship fellowship program takes place over six weeks and combines one-on-one sessions along with group classes. Each session will last approximately one hour. 

 

What is FPI? 

The solutions to today's problems cannot be constructed in the minds of only half the population. To address them, we must meaningfully change whom we call upon as experts.

Three years ago, we – two female foreign policy practitioners – were tired of complaining about the dearth of female voices in the media; we felt stuck in a conversational cul-de-sac where solutions were never discussed. Our frustration led us to launch Foreign Policy Interrupted, an initiative to amplify female voices in international affairs.

FPI is solution-oriented. We’re not interested in the social media echo chamber. If we’re going to combat gender inequity, we must do more than merely acknowledge the problem. We need results.

As we wrote in the New York Times in 2015:

Brilliant female foreign policy minds exist in spades — it’s just a matter of how we get them on the op-ed page and on television talking about their expertise on a level equal to men. The stakes are high, not only for gender parity, but for our perceptions of the world.

 

 

What we do

Foreign Policy Interrupted has built a brain trust of female foreign policy experts and a platform for them to showcase their talent. Our goal is to change the perception about women as thought leaders by tapping into and unleashing their enormous potential to add value to the media, government, development, academia, national security, and the global economy.

Currently our approach combines career/personal coaching and media training, while serving as a talent agency for some of the most brilliant women in the world.

 

Coaching and media training

Through our own trademarked curriculum, FPI provides personalized coaching and mentoring for qualified women. Our curriculum covers confidence and brand building, media and leadership training.

Talent agency

Following our six-week fellowship program, we match fellows with media outlets. Currently we work with Foreign Policy, Foreign Affairs, The Financial Times, New York Times, CNN, World Policy Journal, and Reuters. Fellows work with one of these outlets in an informal “externship” where they conceive articles for publication.

 

What we want to do

 

FPI has two main goals:

  • Interrupt outdated institutions (media, government, think tanks, academia, etc.)  that keep women at the margins
  • Combat unconscious bias and nurture talent

 

Interrupt institutions

Deeply entrenched sexism and bias, unconscious or otherwise, deem male voices as authoritative. In turn, women are second-guessed. This is compounded by a 140-character driven news cycle in which producers and editors don’t have the bandwidth to identify, much less cultivate, new voices. They fall back on what they know – and that’s usually a long list of white men. FPI works with media outlets to identify and incubate female voices.

To ensure progress, we track this data with Media Matters for America and through our own in-house data analytics team.

Combat unconscious bias and nurture talent

Confidence matters as much as competence. Studies show that women hold themselves to a higher threshold of certainty before offering an opinion. Women are far more anxious and self-conscious about marketing their own expertise than men – despite pages of qualifications and years of experience. (Ahem, the U.S. presidential campaign, anyone?)

Through a comprehensive fellowship program and workshops, FPI works to shift mindsets, in both men and women, and help women tap into their awesomeness

How we do it:

  • Education
  • Data analytics
  • Amplifying voices
  • Creating spaces

Education: We tackle the gender parity in media through our flagship FPI Fellowship Program. This is a six week program focused on media training, confidence building, and building your brand. It’s been a wonderful learning experience for us - one in which we keep building on an iterating. We’ve developed different workshops and seminars for women at every career stage: recent grads, early career, mid career. Our courses are designed to recognize each person’s strengths, overcome challenges, and move forward to interrupt.

Data analytics: The male-talk fest isn’t just anecdotal (or in our lady brains). For the past three years, in collaboration with Media Matters for America, we have conducted an analysis of foreign policy guests on major news programs. FPI is now digging deeper. We’re building a data analytics team that will dive deep into print and electronic media (television and radio), tracking gender numbers.

Amplifying voices: Where are the women? FPI aggregates op-eds, articles, and other thought pieces written by women in a weekly newsletter. We also run a Q&A series featuring women in national security and international affairs and a book club. Don’t let anyone ever tell you that there aren’t qualified women in a given discipline. We know where they are and we give them the microphone they deserve.

Creating spaces: The cigar bar. The golf course. Men have always made time and space to gather - to network, collaborate, and exchange ideas. FPI is dedicated to creating spaces for women in every discipline to do the same. We have held a number of events and we are eager to host more, including an Interrupted Conference. This isn’t merely a Tupperware coffee clutch. Its high time to roll up our sleeves and talk policy.

 

 

Finally, a very special thanks to the brilliant Jennie Spector, our intern-turned-content manager, for helping us design this campaign (and figure out Snapchat).

 

The future is beautiful. And it is female. 

Holler at us: info@fpinterrupted.com

story:
Our Mission

Feya Candles are made with 100% Soy Wax and beautiful design; their purpose is to connect human life through food. You may not always have the opportunity to lend a helping hand in person, but Feya allows your love to spread throughout the World - giving a meal to someone in need with each candle purchased. Come with us on this adventure of a lifetime - grow your love, and change the World with Feya.

I'm Sarah - I began Feya, inspired by the love of family and the love of food.  Feya wasn't just my idea though, my grandmother Faye and aunt Pamela believed in two things (among others): 1. Have a great amount of love for everyone; 2. Feeding people is a great way to show your love!  They have since both passed and to honor them and continue their legacy - I chose Feya, the absolute embodiment of their compassion and giving, as well as a combination of their names!

At Feya we partner with local non-profits to deliver the food all over the World.  The Feya Mission is more about just giving food, it's about involving the community around us in something beyond our front door step.  Feya makes it simple and accessible to learn more about giving-back through local non-profits and groups throughout the World. 

Our first giving trip in June of 2014 we'll be partnering with Jacob's Well - Lincoln to deliver all meals raised to residents of Montrouis, Haiti.  This small community in Haiti is faced with extreme poverty, daily hardships and have needs for basic essentials.  The amount of food and aid we're able to give is remarkable, in partnership with Jacob's Well we'll be able to give hundreds of meals as well as dedicate our time there to building a community center, aid in community events and plan outings with children of the orphanages in the area. 

Each donation to this campaign will take us a step further in reaching our goal of traveling to Montrouis, Haiti this summer - and a step closer to changing our World.


What We Need & What You Get

I need $2000 in order to get myself to Haiti to deliver meals in Montrouis, Haiti.  This will cover the cost of airfare, lodging, food and supplies for 8 days in Haiti - any additional funds raised will be to help construct the community center in Montrouis being built by Jacob's Well right now!

Stretch Goal - $15,000 will allow us to not only get to Montrouis, deliver all meals raised, and also fund the completion of the new Montrouis Community Center!

Here's what YOU get in return: $20 donation will receive a handwritten thank you. $50 donation will receive a candle and a thank you.  $100 donation will receive a candle and a framed picture of those fed on our giving trip. $150+ will receive two candles, a picture, and a listing on our website as a donor 


The Impact

Helping us get to Montrouis, Haiti will guarantee:

  • Hundreds of healthy balanced meals delivered to children & residents of Montrouis, Haiti.
  • Our time will be spent aiding in group events with the orphanages & community center.
  • You'll help us build a community of hope, not only in Haiti but here in the U.S. as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Feya!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us out on Facebook: www.facebook/hallowcandlelincoln 
  • Follow us on Twitter @feyacandles
  • Remember to check out my website to find Feya locations and updates on the project http://www.hallowcandle.com/feya/
story_txt:

You may not always have the opportunity to lend a helping hand in person, but Feya allows your love to spread throughout the World - giving a meal to someone in need with each candle purchased. Come with us on this adventure of a lifetime - grow your love, and change the World with Feya.I'm Sarah - I began Feya, inspired by the love of family and the love of food.  Feya wasn't just my idea though, my grandmother Faye and aunt Pamela believed in two things (among others): 1. story:
Help Fund Justice

I am Ron Napoles, a Bishop Paiute Tribal member here in Bishop California. This campaign is to secure funding to fight the Bishop Paiute Tribal Council in court. Our tribe does not have a constitution to secure civil rights within our sovereign nation.  This fact has led to concentrated and unbalanced power with our tribal council. The council has taken 2 acres of our land assignment which are adjacent to our local Indian casino without due process of any kind.  We have retained an Indian Law attorney who is actively engaged with Bureau of Indian Affairs officials on the matter of who has legitimate rights to occupy the land. We are ramping up to go to federal court on this matter. 

Also, 6 of my family members and 2 supporters (including 5 tribal elders) are appealing trespass citations issued  by the tribal police for protesting on our own land.  My brother and myself are facing additional charges of trespassing and nuisance for obstructing tribal workers and equipment while trying to stop construction of a chain link fence across our land. I have also filed assault charges on two tribal employees. 

This is a case of civil rights. As tribal members and American citizens we are protected by the Bill of Rights and the Indian Civil Rights Act of 1968. Our reservation has become a place of fear and intimidation from the tribal council.  Adequate funding of our legal defenses for both federal and tribal court will allow us to finally assert our rights in an impartial forum and force the tribal council to answer for its actions.  The outcome of our case will bring a sense of justice to our reservation and will drive forward the absolute necessity of creating and adhering to a tribal constitution and will show everyone that the tribal council cannot deny civil rights at will. 

Two Court Cases 

Our tribal council has its own paid lawyers to represent their interests paid for by the tribe. They have banked on the fact that tribal members simply cannot afford to fight in court. 
We are raising $50K for legal fees and court costs. Our family has retained an Indian Law attorney and pulled together an initial $5,000 to start this process with the Bureau of Indian Affairs-  Pacific Region. We are expecting to go to federal court which will surely be time consuming and costly. This attorney will focus solely on the land issue with federal officials and the Bishop Paiute Tribal Council. Attorney's rate is $250 per hour. 
We are also utilizing the services of a second attorney experienced in Indian Law who is offering her services free of charge. She is focusing on the trespass citations and our trespass appeal and research. Although she is not charging us we will pay for travel, lodging, and necessities as she resides out of state. She has already put in several hours on the case and if we can, we will offer compensation for her time. The reason we are fighting the trespass case is that it can provide us a 'stay' on casino expansion and will allow us to present our case for having the right to be on our own land. Our local tribal court is set up, and financed by the tribal council.  The tribal court judge is paid by the council and has limited power.  The council has maintained most power for itself, specifically concerning land assignments. 

For perks we are offering original authentic Native American art work!  We have locally printed Save North Pa Ha T-shirts. We also have poster prints, hand sewn clothing, bags and material goods for specific donation amounts.  Finally we will be kicking in some locally made bead-work and various Indian art from family and friends. 

All funds raised will be put into court cost, lawyer fees and any incidental cost strictly related to the court case. 

The Situation and Our Approach

Especially for non-Indians, what is happening here on the Bishop Paiute Reservation within the United States of America is hard to believe. Our tribe is a sovereign nation, with its own government, and operates largely without Bureau of Indian Affairs oversight. Without a constitution we are operating with no guarantee of civil rights.  Daily we go into downtown Bishop and are afforded all the rights of any American citizen. Then, upon returning home we leave our civil rights in the hands and opinion of 5 temporarily elected people. The tribal council is legislative, executive, and, judicial branches all in one. The tribal council has a wealth of resources including tribal employees, the tribal police, even the tribal court. So, we are at a severe disadvantage.  

With our limited resources of money, people, and power we have been operating in a strategic and creative mode. The elders of our family, my mother and aunt, have been engaged in tribal business serving on several boards and entities from elections, housing, enrollment and even constitution committees. They are a continuous source of information and history. My mother has kept decades of tribal and BIA documentation that are the basis of our land assignment court case. My brother and I have spent our careers with the federal government as wildland firefighters.  He is a Division Chief for the US Forest Service and I am a currently a Park Ranger for the BLM. I have spent 21 years with the Kern Valley Interagency Hotshot Crew where I was a Superintendent in my last 10 years. We think and plan strategically and the elders help provide context to what we are trying to do.  I have a background in writing, innovation, and computer graphics.  Everything we produce is well thought out and we rely on facts, documentation and reality to support our actions.  We have utilized social media. You can see our story on Facebook SaveNorthPaHa.  We have submitted editorials to the local newspaper and have met with reporters to relate the facts of our fight. 

This situation is as ironic as it gets. We are Native Americans who are fighting to keep our land - not against the "white man" - but our own tribal council. We have engaged with the tribal council and everyone else who will listen.  We have taken this fight as far as we can and now we need your help. 

How You Can Help

Please take a moment and donate what you can. If you can't donate please send this link to all your contacts and ask them to do whatever they can. Thank you.

story:
Amazing man publicly insulted for MONEY!

Todd's friends are appealing to you on his behalf.  This wonderful man dumped by his wife and then drug through the mud online needs your help. 

Todd raised a stepson from the age of three and his own two children.  Once they were almost raised Todd re married.  Not only did he marry taking on one more mouth to feed, but she had 5 children to boot.  NOT an easy task for any man to handle.,

At the lowest point of his life, business failing, working away from home for over 3 years and near mental breakdown, his wife, out of the blue, informed him she wanted a divorce leaving him near suicidal and stuck in North Dakota with no place to call home.

And to further add salt to the wound, Todd was publicly humiliated on line with his wife posting  the divorce blindsided her and she did not see it coming and that she supported him through all of his failed business attempts. This almost pushed Todd over the brink.

One day, not long ago, Todd was to that point, and a dear friend talked him into calling a hotline, where he was then transferred into a computerized VOICEMAIL system where he go no help at all.  Yes, this is one of those things you think will NEVER happen to you, and so did Todd until recently.

The Crisis

This summer, Todd was stunned with a marital breakup the he did not see coming!  Now he will tell you that he does have issues that he would have worked through with his wife but she was unwilling to go through any type of counseling to at least attempt so save what bond they had left.

Todd and his wife had a beautiful home in the small town off Coeur d'Alene Idaho which was full of beautiful art, furniture (most of which Todd built), and beautiful musical instruments including a 1860 concert grand piano which Todd bought his wife, before they were married as a birthday gift, but when the economy tanked in Idaho, he, like so many other men, had to go to North Dakota, to keep food on the table for his wife and her 5 children.

His wife did have a job at that time at a local law firm in Idaho but lost that shortly after Todd went to North Dakota and has not had a paying job since.

Generally working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day for 3 weeks straight and then making the long dangerous drive, almost 1200 miles each way Todd would do it relentlessly to give his family what emotional support he had left.  He would stay home for generally 5 days, and then exhausted, turn around and make the 1200 mile drive again back to his long strenuous job.

Over the past 3 months Todd's work has tanked with him loosing tens of thousands of dollars on his last three construction projects leaving him penniless and humiliated.

All of his personal belongings, the ones he did not leave at the residence where he was forced to flee, are in two small storage buildings in North Idaho which he can not afford to go get.

Todd could make it easy on himself and just walk away from his obligations but his integrity will not let him do that.  He and his son are working around the clock, almost for free to finish up these jobs so his clients are not left with undone projects.

The Man

A go getter, resiliant and never stops this man has done it all.  He has taken on 6 children to raise in his life that were not his own, as well as raising his own two children.  In both of his marriages, his wife's were never made to work, and normally did not.  Todd always worked harder than anyone else to provide everything his family needed, and usually much much more.
Always putting his own welfare and well-being aside and providing for his family and his customers this man has always made it through the most amazing circumstances to get back on top.
Now his is beat and needs to move on and needs your help.
Todd is a truly gifted craftsman and his desire is to move back to Texas and re-establish his custom furniture company, a skill he truly loves, but due to his circumstances can not make it without your help.
He is planning to spend the next six weeks working where he is to finish his jobs if possible, and pay off the suppliers he owes money to.  After that his plan is to move to Austin, but having his equipment n North Dakota, some personal belongings in Idaho, and winter right around the corner, the possibilities for this man are narrowing fast.

This is some of the wonderful work of Todd's, lets all give back to the man for a change and let him get back to what he loves and does so well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
2020 UPDATE:

We are excited to announce that we just acquired FIVE abandoned houses, which we will turn into beautiful homes for families who need them! 

 

They are all within walking distance of our hub here at Simple Homes.  As with all our renovations, we will sell them for $35,000 (with a no-interest mortgage) to a low-income family. 

 

We don’t build homes FOR families, we build homes WITH families.  So each homeowner will contribute 350 hours of work on their home. We team them up with friends and volunteers and turn the abandoned house into a home.  It’s all one big web of friends working together to make this happen. 

 

So we need your help.  We are committed to raising $30,000 per house.  And each Holiday Season we do just that.  As we remember all that we are thankful for, please help us give back and support a family who needs a home. 

 

Those in shelters and on the streets are especially at risk during the pandemic, so let us remember them in our prayers… but let us also put flesh on our prayers by funding a HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS.  

 

WILL YOU HELP SPONSOR A HOME?

story:
NOTE:  you can donate anonymously or block the amount contributed if you wish, and you may choose another amount of your choice, if you prefer by hitting "contribute now" and scroll to the bottom and then select, "no perk, just contribution" and type in any amount.  Indiegogo.com is a SECURE site via credit/debit or Paypal.
 
YOU CAN BE PART OF THIS COMEBACK STORY WHICH WILL RE-LAUNCH OUR SUSTAINABLE, CHARITABLE BUSINESS THAT WILL GENERATE $ FOR KIDS FOR GENERATIONS TO COME...WITH YOUR ONE-TIME CONTRIBUTION.    (the "Paul Newman's" of pierogies).  Are you tired of making donations to some non-profits only to find out most of the $ goes to administrative?   We are giving 2/3's of our net profits after taxes toward the betterment of children...
 
FOR ANY QUESTIONS OR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE CONTACT FOUNDER, MARY POLDRUHI AT 440-785-7094, mtp@glwb.net
 
 
WHO WE ARE, WHAT WE ARE ABOUT—The “Paul Newman” of Pierogies…
Join us in our mission to preserve the time-honored tradition of old world pierogies and bring back “old-fashioned taste in new frozen foods—PARMA PIEROGIES” once again to your grocer’s freezer!  We are re-launching the manufacturing division of  Parma Pierogies, and this time, we will be contributing 2/3’s of our net profits after taxes toward the betterment of children in the area of battered and abused kids.  Yes, that’s 2/3’s of our net profits after taxes—by law, non-profits ONLY have to give 5% to charity!? -- we are HopeAid, LLC, a newly formed charitable organization in Ohio with nationwide distribution--our 2/3’s net profits after taxes going to charity,  is part of our Operating Agreement and is listed in our Articles of Incorporation.
 
The founder of Parma Pierogies, Mary Poldruhi, believes “we can do with pierogies what Paul Newman has done for his charities with his Newman’s Own brand of salad dressings, juices, and more!"
 
 
OUR HISTORY
Parma Pierogies was a Cleveland, Ohio, success story in the nineties.  Initially setting out to franchise Polish fast-food, Mary successfully ran restaurants in several locations.  Mary's motivation was to build the franchise nationally, then begin her philanthropic efforts to help battered and abused children.  Her entrepreneurial efforts caught the national attention in Time magazine, Entrepreneur magazine and she was featured twice in Restaurant Hospitality, where the editors named  Parma Pierogies “the next McDonald's or Olive Garden”.   Though not politically affiliated, President Clinton visited the flagship restaurant twice, and Mary was selected by him as one of his 53 Faces of Hope.  The exposure brought more coverage, on NBC Nightly News, CNBC, and other national and local media. > Next, Parma Pierogies expanded into the grocery market and they landed placement with six varieties of homestyle pierogies in nearly every grocer's freezer in the tri-state area.  
 
 
THE BUMP IN THE ROAD
After nearly a decade of success...what happened?  Several of our key resources, an attorney, an  automation equipment dealer, and a major investor broke  the trust we had placed in them.  In a climate where economic expansion was difficult, we had no choice but to close the doors. 
 
Recently, a phone call to Mary from a friend working in children's services triggered her entrepreneurial zeal again. "My friend told me an horrific story of a child,” she related, “who was returned to an abusive home because of a system loophole that eventually ended in the child's death.”
 
 
OUR COMEBACK!
The world is hungry for food from the heart!  We are poised to bring back that old-world, authentic taste of Parma Pierogies.  Our pierogies are low in fat, and contain no preservatives.
 
Today, we have a new business plan in hand.  It was recently selected a Council of Smaller Enterprises Business Pitch finalist, as judged by a panel of successful entrepreneurs including Daymond Jon of ABC's Shark Tank.  The first steps of the plan are to secure and renovate a building and  acquire the state-of-the-art automation equipment we need.  
 
 
HERE’S WHERE WE NEED YOU!  
Help us rebuild a successful business which will also support causes that better the lives of at-risk children.  The amount our plan calls for is high but it will give us the equipment and initial working capital we need. 52.3% of our goal will go toward the automation and related equipment and renovation of the warehouse, while 47.7% will go toward 6 months of operating expenses.   Providence House (www.provhouse.org) is our primary beneficiary.  It is the nation's oldest crisis nursery, and they have listed us on their website under “upcoming/ongoing” events.  They also focus on prevention.  The other like-minded beneficiary in Lorain County, Ohio, is:  Blessing House at www.blessinghouse.org
 
In pursuit of traditional funding, Mary related that she “nearly signed a major bank loan and almost gave 2/3 ownership of the company to a potential investor.”. She was “devastated to lose out on that opportunity from the angel investor until a light bulb went off -- we, as individuals and as a company, can be the ANGELS to children everyday!.”
 
 
WON'T YOU PLEASE GIVE WHAT YOU CAN TO HELP US AND HELP KIDS? 
We deeply appreciate any help. Your contribution will make a big difference, and every $5, $10, $50, $100 or more, matters much.  Please spread the word to your family, friends, co-workers and community connections, via word-of-mouth or certainly by using social media.  THANK YOU SO MUCH, Best Regards, Mary
 
www.parmapierogies.com
 
www.parmapierogies.wordpress.com
 
www.twitter.com/parmapierogies1
 
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Parma-Pierogies/326657357395139

 

"I Refuse" - Ben Glover and Josh Wilson

Sometimes I
I just want to close my eyes
And act like everyone's alright
When I know they're not

I could say a prayer and just move on
Like nothing's wrong
But I refuse
'Cause I don't want to live like I don't care
I don't want to say another empty prayer

I can hear the least of these

Crying out so desperately
It's time for me to follow through
And do what I was made to do
To sit around and wait for someone else,

I could choose--but I refuse

Video Production and original Garage Band music by Jared John Fisher

D. Sharon Pruitt, David Shankbone, Miika Silfverberg, Alex Buiter,

NOTE:  you can donate anonymously or block the amount contributed if you wish, and you may choose another amount of your choice, if you prefer by hitting "contribute now" and scroll to the bottom and then select, "no perk, just contribution" and type in any amount.  Indiegogo.com is a SECURE site via credit/debit or Paypal.
 
YOU CAN BE PART OF THIS COMEBACK STORY WHICH WILL RE-LAUNCH OUR SUSTAINABLE, CHARITABLE BUSINESS THAT WILL GENERATE $ FOR KIDS FOR GENERATIONS TO COME...WITH YOUR ONE-TIME CONTRIBUTION.    (the "Paul Newman's" of pierogies).  Are you tired of making donations to some non-profits only to find out most of the $ goes to administrative?   We are giving 2/3's of our net profits after taxes toward the betterment of children...
 
FOR ANY QUESTIONS OR MORE INFORMATION, PLEASE CONTACT FOUNDER, MARY POLDRUHI AT 440-785-7094, mtp@glwb.net

 
 
WHO WE ARE, WHAT WE ARE ABOUT—The “Paul Newman” of Pierogies…
Join us in our mission to preserve the time-honored tradition of old world pierogies and bring back “old-fashioned taste in new frozen foods—PARMA PIEROGIES” once again to your grocer’s freezer!  We are re-launching the manufacturing division of  Parma Pierogies, and this time, we will be contributing 2/3’s of our net profits after taxes toward the betterment of children in the area of battered and abused kids.  Yes, that’s 2/3’s of our net profits after taxes—by law, non-profits ONLY have to give 5% to charity!? -- we are HopeAid, LLC, a newly formed charitable organization in Ohio with nationwide distribution--our 2/3’s net profits after taxes going to charity,  is part of our Operating Agreement and is listed in our Articles of Incorporation.
 
The founder of Parma Pierogies, Mary Poldruhi, believes “we can do with pierogies what Paul Newman has done for his charities with his Newman’s Own brand of salad dressings, juices, and more!"
 
 
OUR HISTORY
Parma Pierogies was a Cleveland, Ohio, success story in the nineties.  Initially setting out to franchise Polish fast-food, Mary successfully ran restaurants in several locations.  Mary's motivation was to build the franchise nationally, then begin her philanthropic efforts to help battered and abused children.  Her entrepreneurial efforts caught the national attention in Time magazine, Entrepreneur magazine and she was featured twice in Restaurant Hospitality, where the editors named  Parma Pierogies “the next McDonald's or Olive Garden”.   Though not politically affiliated, President Clinton visited the flagship restaurant twice, and Mary was selected by him as one of his 53 Faces of Hope.  The exposure brought more coverage, on NBC Nightly News, CNBC, and other national and local media. > Next, Parma Pierogies expanded into the grocery market and they landed placement with six varieties of homestyle pierogies in nearly every grocer's freezer in the tri-state area.  
 
 
THE BUMP IN THE ROAD
After nearly a decade of success...what happened?  Several of our key resources, an attorney, an  automation equipment dealer, and a major investor broke  the trust we had placed in them.  In a climate where economic expansion was difficult, we had no choice but to close the doors. 
 
Recently, a phone call to Mary from a friend working in children's services triggered her entrepreneurial zeal again. "My friend told me an horrific story of a child,” she related, “who was returned to an abusive home because of a system loophole that eventually ended in the child's death.”
 
 
OUR COMEBACK!
The world is hungry for food from the heart!  We are poised to bring back that old-world, authentic taste of Parma Pierogies.  Our pierogies are low in fat, and contain no preservatives.
 
Today, we have a new business plan in hand.  It was recently selected a Council of Smaller Enterprises Business Pitch finalist, as judged by a panel of successful entrepreneurs including Daymond Jon of ABC's Shark Tank.  The first steps of the plan are to secure and renovate a building and  acquire the state-of-the-art automation equipment we need.  
 
 
HERE’S WHERE WE NEED YOU!  
Help us rebuild a successful business which will also support causes that better the lives of at-risk children.  The amount our plan calls for is high but it will give us the equipment and initial working capital we need. 52.3% of our goal will go toward the automation and related equipment and renovation of the warehouse, while 47.7% will go toward 6 months of operating expenses.   Providence House (www.provhouse.org) is our primary beneficiary.  It is the nation's oldest crisis nursery, and they have listed us on their website under “upcoming/ongoing” events.  They also focus on prevention.  The other like-minded beneficiary in Lorain County, Ohio, is:  Blessing House at www.blessinghouse.org

 
In pursuit of traditional funding, Mary related that she “nearly signed a major bank loan and almost gave 2/3 ownership of the company to a potential investor.”. She was “devastated to lose out on that opportunity from the angel investor until a light bulb went off -- we, as individuals and as a company, can be the ANGELS to children everyday!.”
 
 
WON'T YOU PLEASE GIVE WHAT YOU CAN TO HELP US AND HELP KIDS? 
We deeply appreciate any help. Your contribution will make a big difference, and every $5, $10, $50, $100 or more, matters much.  Please spread the word to your family, friends, co-workers and community connections, via word-of-mouth or certainly by using social media.  THANK YOU SO MUCH, Best Regards, Mary
