story:
Short Summary

The Legal Aid Service of Háttér Society (Hungary) has been providing free legal help and representation for LGBTQI victims of violence, harassment and discrimination for 17 years.

Our clients received death threats, were attacked in shops and while cycling. Some were beaten by neonazis while on their way to the Budapest Pride march – and have reported these hate crimes with our assistance. However, as research shows, less than one fifth of victims report hate crimes. Many of those who do not report these crimes are afraid of homophobic or transphobic reactions from the police. We have to change this. 

UNI-FORM is an online tool and app connecting Háttér and the police to work together to reduce this lack of reporting. Help us make it work!

With your help we can promote this easy-to-use application in the LGBTQI community, and provide more trainings for the police on LGBTQI victims of hate crimes. 

What We Need 

We need 8,500 USD to advertise the online tool and application for reporting hate crimes – the first such tool that connects Háttér and the police and furthers our working together to reduce latency. (Users can decide whether they want to send their reports to Háttér only or both Háttér and the police. The latter option creates a unique opportunity for us to follow up on cases and ensure they are categorized and treated properly by the police.)

With your help, we can also make training materials and hold trainings to educate the police about hate crimes committed against LGBTQI people.  

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use every dollar raised on promoting the online tool and application so that LGBTQI victims of hate crimes know about it, use it, and thus help reduce the lack of reporting of hate crimes and improve police awareness.

Your help 

will promote awareness of LGBTQI people in Hungary of hate crimes, so that they know they are not alone and that they have the right to seek help from the police and victim support services. We'll work to increase the reporting of hate crimes and improve the competency of the police to work with victims.

Our work 

We provide free legal help and representation for LGBTQI victims of violence, harassment and discrimination. Some of our cases in 2017: 

  • we represented an LGBTQI sports organization when a swimming pool refused to let them rent a lane in a swimming pool as part of their annual sports day;
  • turned to the Equal Treatment Authority when an advertising office refused to publish the ad of an organization seeking interwiewees for their oral history video project;
  • have been conducting educational environment research in collaboration with the US-based GLSEN and other countries in our region.  

UNI-FORM, the online tool and app to increase the reporting of hate crimes and connecting LGBTQI victims with the police is also ready.

Help us help LGBTQI people make the best use of it!

story:
The Saint Nicholas Fund

The Saint Nicholas fund is an annual interfaith campaign to raise funds to support organizations working to end human trafficking around the world. We do this in the name of St. Nicholas of Myra, the patron saint of prostitutes.

We will be donating 100% of funds raised to two causes actively working to end human trafficking.

Everyone knows about “Old St. Nick” but not many know the man who inspired the tradition of Santa Claus. St. Nicholas was born March 15, 270 as the only child to a wealthy Greek family living in Roman Asia Minor. His parents died from the plague while he was a teenager, leaving him under the care of his uncle, the local Bishop. Following his parent’s death, he gave away his large inheritance to the poor. 

He loved to give to others, and would make special effort to give in secret and hidden ways. There are many stories of him caring for the sick, giving refuge for strangers, feeding the hungry, and righting wrongs wherever he found them. One of the most famous of these stories inspired contemporary traditions of Santa Claus. In Turkey at this time, in order to marry, a woman must have a dowry. Without a dowry, a woman did not have many prospects in life, and would often end up getting sold into slavery, or in to the sex trade. Once, St. Nicholas heard of three young girls who were going to be sold into slavery by their father, who had no money and no dowry to give. Moved by the plight of these girls, St. Nicholas went to their house in the middle of the night, and threw a bag of gold in through the window, which reportedly landed in a sock hanging above the hearth. 

The tradition of hanging stockings up on the chimney is in honor of St. Nicholas’ deed. Each year, 1.2 million children are trafficked in the global sex trade. It is easy to imagine what Good Old St. Nick would get these children this season. May his example move us to continue his legacy.


Goal 1 -  Buy 20 nights of freedom for sex slaves in Thailand. 

In 2009, Christine Gelatt founded Freedom 4/24 on the simple conviction that human beings are not commodities. After witnessing an adolescent girl being purchased for $24 in Thailand, she dreamt of ways to be a conduit of change by mobilizing people who share her conviction and banding together to bring an end to the injustice of human trafficking and sexual exploitation. The founding team thought, what if we used that same number, $24, and showed people how even a small sum of money can be used to bring lasting, holistic freedom rather than oppression, shame and hopelessness? (freedom424.org)


Goal 2 - Provide 10 micro-grants for women leaving the sex trade in Managua Nicaragua

House of Hope, Nicaragua was started in 2004 with the mission of rescuing women and young girls from the sex trade in the capital city of Managua. Each week, they provide spiritual, emotional and vocational support to more than 350 women, providing a means of income for them and their families, as well as love, hope and peace.

They also have an on site program that provides shelter for women and girls leaving the sex trade and allows them opportunity to get an education, to live in a safe environment and receive a new start in life. Out of this residential program, they provide micro-grants for women who have a plan to start a small business to provide a means of support for themselves and their families, breaking the generational shackles of prostitution. With $75, these women are sent out with a second chance and most importantly, with hope.


Starting out

This campaign started as a conversation between two friends that crossed the country and started a movement among 4 people who wanted to create awareness of the TRUE story of one of the greatest examples of love and charity, Saint Nicholas of Myra, create awareness of the thing closest to St. Nick's heart and one of the greatest problem facing our society today, human trafficking. 


So you know...

As stated before, 100% of every penny raised will go towards the two goals stated. There are 0 administrative costs. All perks will be covered out of the pockets of the founders

These two organizations have been personally and thoroughly researched and their outreach seen first hand by the founders of this fund.


For further info - 

Please visit houseofhopenicaragua.com and freedom424.org

For any questions about the Saint Nicholas Fund, please email aaron.t.andrews@gmail.com


Thank you, and Happy Holidays!

story:
This is the new campaign page for Operation Refugee Child, building on our previous campaign that raised $201,884.

 

The Today Show on several occasions has featured a segment on Operation Refugee Child.  If you can't catch the show live you can view content on the below links which have footage from our volunteers' recent trip to Greece where we distributed 1650 lbs. of aid supplies to refugee children and families in Athens and Lesvos.

 

Today Show Video links:
http://on.today.com/1pkQ4lZ
http://on.today.com/1pdlzOb

Today Show Article Links:
http://www.today.com/parents/more/making-a-difference
http://www.today.com/parents/refugee-crisis-how-american-moms-decided-make-difference-kids-t78941
http://www.today.com/parents/look-inside-operation-refugee-child-backpacks-t79716

 

 

Visit our website www.operationrefugeechild.org for more information! 


OPERATION REFUGEE CHILD 

Our Mission

Operation Refugee Child (ORC) distributes backpacks with basic necessities to bring comfort, health, safety and warmth to refugee children and families who have left everything behind.   Through our international network of volunteers and local NGOs in US, Middle East and Europe, we assemble and distribute backpacks to refugee children and families fleeing violence and war. ORC will distribute basic necessities and at least 10,000 backpacks to refugee children in 2016.

HOW YOU CAN HELP! 

1) Sponsor a backpack for a refugee child here.
2) Volunteer with us to help assemble and distribute backpacks (email: info@ operationrefugeechild.org for more information about volunteering).
3) Set up a corporate partnership for in-kind or financial support to Operation Refugee Child.
4) Like and share this campaign! 

      Twitter: @oprefugeechild
      Instagram: @operationrefugeechild
      Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Operationrefugeechild/

5) Pack a shoebox to fill a refugee child backpack -Learn more Here (#refugeehopebox)

All it takes is one person to start changing the world and it can start with you!  

Thank you!

story:
HELP US BUILD THE PEOPLES' DEFENSE NETWORK 

What is this About?  This About Confronting the Prevelance of Racism and Criminality Within the Judiciary Through Grassroots Organizing and Action. 

  Just recently, community people in Washington, D.C. came together to form the Peoples' Defense Network to fashion action to address the wide-spread racism, corruption, and abuse within the local judiciary, they formed the Peoples' Defense Network. The "War on Drugs" has been openly nothing more than a war on black people, add to this that "law enforcement" has always been used as an excuse for racial oppression. The judiciary across this country is rife with racism, corruption, and abuse.

  Because DC is a colony, the judges are imposed on us, as is a U.S. Attorney as the local prosecutor. These people have no real relationship with the communities of DC, particularly not the black and impoverished ones. They have no regard for the rights of black and impoverished residents. Judges of the D.C. "Superior" court routinely allow and support police and the U.S. Attorney instigating malicious prosecutions. This is criminal, but many of the judges of that court are actively engaged in this conduct as a matter of practice. Far too many of the judges do not know the law because they do believe that they have to account under the law.

  The immedaite task of Peoples' Defense Network is to take on the local judiciary, to mobilize and organize to expose it, and to force it to reform and make concessions. Community people will be educated in the basics of law and will then begin to monitor the conduct of judges in the "Superior" court. Bad judges will be identified by having people fill out an intake form. From this we develop a data base, which we will publish over the web, identifying the worst offenders.  By way of an intake form, the PDN will identify practices and show patterns of lawlessness. 

   The PDN will then press the Commission on Judicial Disability and Tenure to investigate complaints and take demanded action against lawless judges. Currently, the Commission does not conduct investigations, but rather works exclusively to conceal lawlessness with the DC judiciary. The Commission answers to the DC City Council Committee on the Judiciary, and it is by way of also putting pressure on councilmembers under threat of defeating them in the next election, that we also bring pressure to bear on the Commission. In holding the Commission to task with increased public scrutiny, we bring pressure to bear on the judges, meaning a drastic reduction in the number of malicious prosecutions, wrongful imprisonment. 

What We Need

Funds to:

  • Secure a work space
  • Secure basic work equipment
  • Create and print educational and organizing material
  • secure regular meeting spaces and conduct classes around the city
  • support public education and community outreach

We intend to organize and conduct  a "Judge Watch" program, whereby community members will monitor and report on the conduct of particular judges. We will provide every person who participates with a pocket copy of the U.S. Constitution, Know Your Rights cards, and a copy of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

The Impact

   A main impact of this effort will be a more informed and organized public capable of forcing systemic change in the quality of conduct within and by the judiciary. A second impact will be to police the U.S. Attorney, end the practice of pursuing malicious prosecutions. Through the judge watch we will ensure that judges are performing due ministerial duties, such as conducting the due probable cause detemination. Everyone benefits from courts that operate in accordance with the rule of law, rather than rule based on considerations of race, class, and caste. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools below to do it.
story_txt:
HELP US BUILD THE PEOPLES' DEFENSE NETWORK 
What is this About?  This About Confronting the Prevelance of Racism and Criminality Within the Judiciary Through Grassroots Organizing and Action. 
  Just recently, community people in Washington, D.C. came together to form the Peoples' Defense Network to fashion action to address the wide-spread racism, corruption, and abuse within the local judiciary, they formed the Peoples' Defense Network. The "War on Drugs" has been openly nothing more than a war on black people, add to this that "law enforcement" has always been used as an excuse for racial oppression. The judiciary across this country is rife with racism, corruption, and abuse.
  Because DC is a colony, the judges are imposed on us, as is a U.S. Attorney as the local prosecutor. These people have no real relationship with the communities of DC, particularly not the black and impoverished ones. They have no regard for the rights of black and impoverished residents. Judges of the D.C. "Superior" court routinely allow and support police and the U.S. Attorney instigating malicious prosecutions. This is criminal, but many of the judges of that court are actively engaged in this conduct as a matter of practice. Far too many of the judges do not know the law because they do believe that they have to account under the law.
  The immedaite task of Peoples' Defense Network is to take on the local judiciary, to mobilize and organize to expose it, and to force it to reform and make concessions. Community people will be educated in the basics of law and will then begin to monitor the conduct of judges in the "Superior" court. Bad judges will be identified by having people fill out an intake form. From this we develop a data base, which we will publish over the web, identifying the worst offenders.  By way of an intake form, the PDN will identify practices and show patterns of lawlessness. 
   The PDN will then press the Commission on Judicial Disability and Tenure to investigate complaints and take demanded action against lawless judges. Currently, the Commission does not conduct investigations, but rather works exclusively to conceal lawlessness with the DC judiciary. The Commission answers to the DC City Council Committee on the Judiciary, and it is by way of also putting pressure on councilmembers under threat of defeating them in the next election, that we also bring pressure to bear on the Commission. In holding the Commission to task with increased public scrutiny, we bring pressure to bear on the judges, meaning a drastic reduction in the number of malicious prosecutions, wrongful imprisonment. 
What We Need
Funds to:



Secure a work space
Secure basic work equipment
Create and print educational and organizing material
secure regular meeting spaces and conduct classes around the city
support public education and community outreach

We intend to organize and conduct  a "Judge Watch" program, whereby community members will monitor and report on the conduct of particular judges. We will provide every person who participates with a pocket copy of the U.S. Constitution, Know Your Rights cards, and a copy of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.


The Impact

A second impact will be to police the U.S. Attorney, end the practice of pursuing malicious prosecutions. Through the judge watch we will ensure that judges are performing due ministerial duties, such as conducting the due probable cause detemination. Everyone benefits from courts that operate in accordance with the rule of law, rather than rule based on considerations of race, class, and caste. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools below to do it.

story:
I am heading to Lesvos, Greece in January 2016 to help the incoming refugees.

For years, refugees from war torn countries have been fleeing persecution and violence hoping to seek safe refuge in Europe, risking everything on perilous journeys across the Mediterranean to reach the shores of Lesvos in Greece. Numbers increased dramatically in October 2015 and thousands of migrants now arrive daily on the shores of the Greek island. Aid organisations and the Greek government are struggling to handle the influx of migrants, and as a result, living conditions are deteriorating and there is not enough medical care to go around.

Volunteers from all over are coming to Lesvos to help. I will be joining them to provide as much assistance and support as I can.

Weak and traumatised from their journey, refugees without adequate support and help are vulnerable to harassment, exploitation and abuse. Help me fund life-saving supplies and equipment desperately needed by these refugees, especially in the coming winter months. This will include: blankets, socks, underwear, trousers, hats, gloves, shoes, sleeping bags, tents, water, oral rehydration salts and food. My personal expenses such as cost of flight, transportation, accommodation and food will be self funded.

100% of your donations will go directly to the refugees.

All supplies will also be bought locally in Greece to support the local economy. This is a crucial principle of humanitarian work and it ensures that the local economy is supported as much as the refugees are. 

I will personally update you on how the money has been used on a daily basis and how it directly benefits the refugees. Follow me on @tBlinkteam on Twitter or @theBlinkTeam on Instagram for updates! The work that I will be involved in includes:

  • distributing aid, clothes and food
  • unpacking boxes of donations and sorting goods
  • driving donated goods to other places on the island
  • cleaning up beaches and roads
  • cleaning up around camp and bus areas
  • picking up refugees who arrive on remote beaches
  • preparing food for the refugees and other volunteers
Anyone can help, and any help would be truly appreciated.

It is people like you who donate, and the volunteers on the ground that make all the difference in the world to the refugees. If you're interested in joining the cause and helping me out, give me a shout!

Thank you for your generosity and support. :)

Serene Ho

For more information on the work that the Lesvos Volunteers do, check these out:

1. Lesvos Volunteers - These are amazing teams working on the north coast of Lesvos. They provide the refugees arriving by boat with dry clothes and shoes, rain ponchos, sleeping bags, food, medical help, information, buses, etc.

2. Information Point for Lesvos Volunteers - The teams on the frontline on Lesvos are under extreme pressure and struggle to meet the requests from volunteers who want to come and help, so this is a forum where we can discuss and help one another, to relieve the teams.

story:
Hi Everyone,

My goal is to run a full marathon and at the same time, save children who are dying from malnutrition. This is a fabulous opportunity to challenge myself and also make a difference to many children who need help.  I never ran a full marathon in my life and it scares the daylight out of me.  Even though it will be tough to train for the marathon in the freezing Canadian winter, I am inspired to do it for the children. I have a beautiful 9 year old daughter named, Siena. Every time I think of  starving children, I think of my daughter.  I know if she was in that situation, I would take a stand and help her. 


We have all felt hunger before from either missing a meal or not eating at all. Just imagine having no food at all and being hungry all the time.

My goal is to raise $10,000, which is enough to feed 370 children for a month. Donations will go towards purchasing VitaMeals and help feed hungry children all around the world. Your help and support would be greatly appreciated. Let's do it together, we can make a difference.

I have already signed up to run the full marathon on  January 18, 2015 in Phoenix Arizona at my own expense,  $140 registration and $360 airfare. Come out and support me! I will be wearing my bib number (N.T.C 888) Nourish The Children.

http://runrocknroll.competitor.com/arizona

PROBLEM:

  • Every six seconds a child dies from malnutrition.
  • More than 800 million people, mostly children, suffer from hunger.
  • Most food aid is in the form of grain that provides calories, but lacks important nutrients for proper health and development.
  • Next year, 5,000,000 children will die from malnutrition.

Why Nourish The Children?

With Nourish the Children, you know what your money will buy—nutritious VitaMeal. You know how your donated VitaMeal will be used—to nourish children in need. You know that your donations will be leveraged with matching donations and through education and disease prevention programs. And you know that you are making a difference, with nearly 100,000 children being nourished every day in countries around the world.

It is easy to Nourish One More Child.

VitaMeal

The Nourish the Children initiative uses a nutrient- dense, not just calorie-dense,  food branded as VitaMeal that has been carefully formulated to provide all essential daily nutrients to nourish a child.

Each VitaMeal bag contains 30 child-size meals.

Each VitaMeal serving contains 25 essential vitamins and minerals, fatty acids, electrolytes and much more

Nourish the Children has helped fight world hunger by supporting projects in many countries including China, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Indonesia, Malawi, Philippines, Fiji and Thailand.

Please help, donate by feeding hungry children and anything helps!  

HOW DO YOU HELP?

purchase a minimum of 1 bag of vitameal to donate.
Canadian pricing:  $26.90 per bag, $107.60 for 4 bags, $132.25 for 5 bags or any combination.
US pricing:  $24.75 per bag,  $49.50 for 2 bags, $99 for 4 bags, $123.75 for 5 bags or any combination

There are 2 ways to go about making a difference.

1.  go to ……. to donate. 
2.  please share.. 
Comments, questions and please message me.

Thank you for your support. Together, we will end world hunger for children, one child at a time.

story:
Since 2012 we have supported more than 2000 people without a place to call home. This winter we hope to make that 2500 people.

Our group has more than 250 passionate volunteers and every penny we receive is spent on the actual cause - donations make our work possible.

During the winter we hand out gift cards, clothing, sleeping bags, meals, books and messages of hope and light to the homeless. The gift cards can be used to buy tents, winter clothing or other life necessities.  

Under One Sky was founded on the principle that humanity is ONE family…we are brothers and sisters regardless of nationality, race, religion, class or any other label.

“Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive” Dalai Lama

The Sad Facts

Our Winter (17/18) efforts will be focused on London’s ever-growing community of homeless. In 2016/17 more than 8000 people slept rough in London – this number has doubled since 2010.

Behind the mask of homelessness hides mental health issues. Close to 90% of the homeless have mental health difficulties with depression being the most common issue.

Take a moment to imagine what it must be like to be alone on the street with a serious mental health issue. Then add to that not just the daily struggles of getting food and shelter but constantly being in danger. The people we meet on the streets tell us their stories of being kicked, beaten, urinated on, set fire to and stolen from. They need to know society has not abandoned them - it is that message we deliver.

How You Make A Difference

Your funds will be spent on buying gift cards to shops that sell basic necessities such as tents, sleeping bags and winter clothing. These will be handed out at our Night for the Homeless events in London. The math is simple…for every £5000 we raise we reach 150 homeless people. 

At the bottom of this page you can read couple of touching stories from our 2016/17 events.

We can’t wait to bring your donation to those who are fighting to stay alive daily.

If you are not in a position to donate then we’d love shout-out on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram etc.

Supporters

 

Campaign Team

 

Street Stories

Bringing music back in Simon’s life - Elephant and Castle tube station

Simon spends his days sitting in a wheelchair outside Elephant and Castle tube. When he realised I’d returned to give him a bag full of goodies he said “that is the nicest thing anyone will do for me this Christmas”. But it got better when he learnt of the £30 gift card…he was close to tears as he said “now I can finally get a radio”. Then he asked what my favourite Christmas tune was, pulled a flute out of his inner pocket and played Silent Night masterfully. I am quite amazed how his mind straight away went to a place of returning the favour. I had a quick peek at Simon over my shoulder as I walked off and by that time he was already wearing the woollen hat from the goodie bag. A really really lovely guy!

A lesson from Michael - Victoria Street
There is an important lesson we can learn from those living on the streets. And maybe if we did as a society…they wouldn’t be on the street. The lesson is very simple: They look after each other. That is not saying they all do that…but we meet many who are caring as much as about the brother or sister in the sleeping bag next to them as themselves. Michael was the first homeless person we met in the night and he made sure to double up on all items as his friend was fast asleep. And that story kept repeating itself, even to the extent that one guy didn’t want anything but was taking supplies for his friend who’d gone to the toilet. Presumably when you hit rock bottom and every act of surviving is a mountain to climb…you start appreciating where possible the value of removing mountains so others don’t have to climb them

We have heard many heart-breaking street stories over the years but often told by people with immense life spark. We have brought many smiles and hugs to those same people and we hope to bring many more this winter with your help.

story:
UPDATE:  We've met our initial goal, but don't let this stop you from donating!  We set our goal low to fund the most immediate pressing needs of the community.  We are hoping to exceed this goal over the next 11 days to pay for legal fees that the community will incur over the next year.  It's not too late to give.

Many of you know that I have worked as an activist and anthropologist focusing on Afro-descendant land rights in Nicaragua for the last fifteen years.  My central engagement has been with a rural fishing and farming community called Monkey Point.  My book manuscript follows this community’s activism for autonomous territorial rights.  After a decade of mobilization, Monkey Point won a title to a large multiethnic territory in 2009 that they share with other Afro-descendant Creole and indigenous Rama communities in the region.

Although this title is inalienable and non-transferable, the central government has recently passed Law 840 (Special Law for the Development of Nicaraguan Infrastructure and Transport related to the Canal, Free Trade Zones, and Associated Infrastructure) granting a 50-year renewable concession to a Chinese venture capitalist to build, own, and operate a series of infrastructure mega-projects on indigenous and Afro-descendant lands.  The projects are diverse and include an interoceanic canal three times the length of the Panama Canal, an industrial port, a petroleum pipeline, an interoceanic railway, an international airport, and a free trade zone.  The Nicaraguan National Assembly passed the law with no consultation or dialogue with civil society or the affected communities, violating indigenous and Afro-descendant statutory rights to self-determination, communal property, and natural resources.  Needless to say, if the projects move forward, they will be environmentally catastrophic, threatening the livelihoods and future existence of the communities directly affected.

The territorial authorities for the communities have responded by submitting a legal appeal to the Supreme Court of Nicaragua.  In the event that the Nicaraguan legal system fails to adequately address their concerns, they are preparing to take the case to the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACHR).  This modest fund will allow Monkey Point to pay legal fees to their long-time legal representative, Dr. Maria Luisa Acosta, and introduce their case to IACHR.  While it is hard to know if the mega-projects will move forward or not, past experience has proven that indigenous and Afro-descendant communities in Nicaragua are far more likely to have their rights respected at the national level when they pursue international legal remedies.

I will administrate the fund, which will be used solely for the payment of legal fees to initiate the complaint in the IACHR.  For those of you who don't know me, I earned my PhD in cultural anthropology from the University of Texas at Austin and am currently an Assistant Professor of Comparative Cultures and Politics at Michigan State University.  If the case advances through the Inter-American Court system, Monkey Point and their allies will need to secure long-term financial support from a counterpart organization.  We have set our fund raising goal low in the hopes that we can met the community's most immediate legal needs in a short time frame.  Any funds raised in excess of our $1000 goal will be used to finance the community's future legal representation.  Donations can be made anonymously and any amount, no matter how modest, is deeply appreciated.  If you have any questions please feel free to contact me directly at <mplegalfund@gmail.com>.


International Press Coverage:

http://www.scmp.com/news/world/article/1275172/nicaragua-indigenous-groups-challenge-hong-kong-built-canal

Nicaraguan Press Coverage:

http://m.laprensa.com.ni/ambito/153058

US Press Coverage:

http://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/14/world/americas/nicaragua-approves-building-its-own-canal.html?_r=0

story:
Women all over the world suffer under the unjust taboos of menstruation. In industrialized countries it is seen as disgusting and embarrassing, while in developing countries it is seen as shameful, unclean, or a disease. For many women suffering the worst of these stigmas, troubles are compounded by lack of menstrual hygiene education and products. These two issues cause girls to drop out of school, enter into child marriages, and perpetuate the cycle of inequality for women.

 

Behind the Flow

Jessica Lambert- Founder

 

 

Whenever I see an issue I always want to lend a creative hand. I’ve always created my own quirky solutions to problems. One day I was finally fed up looking for my go-to menstrual products in my purse. I took to the internet to find a solution and only came across a few homemade items. So, of course, I designed my own. And then I came up with a few more design ideas! I got quite a few laughs that started conversations about my knowledge of the issues which led me to realize that I had to get these to women everywhere. What a great way to spread the word and raise money to fight for the rights of the menstruating, so that one day we can all be period proud!

 

 

The Challenge

In order to keep pricing and shipping low, I need to make a bulk (thousands) order for my designs. Taking preorders will allow me to stay out of debt and start helping girls and women ASAP! Order up! If you have any issues email theflowbag@gmail.com

The Designs

 

I will be able to create more designs soon! The more I sell the more designs I can offer.

The Timeline

The Impact

For many girls and women, the simple pad to help hold the flow can be life changing. Here is what buying a Flow Bag does:

  • keeps girls in school
  • keeps girls from exchanging sex for pads
  • keeps young girls out of child marriage
  • gives women and girls confidence
  • starts programs to help women become business owners
  • ends period stigma
  • enhances health because they are no longer using leaves, sand, or cow dung.

The organizations we work with don't just hand out pads. They empower the women and girls they work with and help them build sustainable solutions, creating markets led by women! Together we will be equipping women with machines like the one below:

 
These machines create biodegradable sanitary towels for pennies! These machines will also create a new market of women owned businesses helping to bring families out of poverty. What are you waiting for?! Let's do this!

 

The Organizations

Still looking for more partners. Email theflowbag@gmail.com for more information.

story:
Thousands of refugees from the Middle East (Syria, Iraq), South Asia (Afghanistan, Pakistan), and Africa (South Sudan, Somalia) poured into Greece in the last few years. Many are now stranded there, and with temperatures dropping, conditions in refugee camps are worse than ever.

We are collecting donations to buy supplies for refugees from local shops in Greece, we're covering our own expenses.  We will use donations to buy the items below:

1. Blankets and thermals. Refugees arrive with the clothes on their backs, many during warmer months without jackets. It is winter in Greece.
2. Small toys for children.  Children spend all day in the camps and even a small distraction can make a big difference to children and their parents.
3. Food, things to read, and other necessities based on refugees' need.

While the need for food and clothing and medical care still exists throughout Greece, we are hearing time and again that one of the most pressing concerns for refugees is legal information and direct assistance with the asylum, relocation, and family reunification procedures. Many refugees on the Greek islands also need critical assistance fighting deportation back to Turkey.

If you've been looking for a way to help civilians affected by wars in the area, this is a direct way for you to contribute. If you've been concerned about where your money will go, this is a way for you to get it directly to the refugees.

story:
Short Summary

The third principle of Kwanzaa is Ujima (collective work and responsibility). It means “to build and maintain our community together and make our brother's and sister's problems our problems and to solve them together.” This is how and why NBUF has instituted its “Feed the Hood” program. Through NBUF’s coalition of organizations and individuals, it has worked to help people of African descent meet the basic needs of food, medical supplies, personal hygiene products and clothes. As a result of capitalism, the majority of resources in this country are controlled by less than ten percent of the population. Therefore it is imperative that people of African descent pool their resources together and work together to solve their problems.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect items that help less fortunate people survive.   We are looking to get items such as first aid kits, fresh fruits and personal hygiene products. You will in turn be able to help people meet some basic needs to survive. You will be able to connect with other like minded people that enjoy volunteering.

The Impact

Your contributions will help those that have been forced to live in a shelter or on the street obtain fresh fruits and personal hygiene products.

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
The Summerhill Festival of Childhood is a community and family-friendly event that will bring together many exciting projects, collaborations, workshops, presentations and performances based on art, craft, educational and child rearing approaches, psychology, sustainability, community and children’s rights for the participants. It will also have an international conference approach and will facilitate seminars, talks and focus group discussions.
Due to the global pandemic we meet online for 2021 and in person in 2022.

Our online event will include the International Democratic Education Conference 2021 which we are proud to host. Many people and organisations  from all over the world have favoured us with participating and our community  is growing every day.

Our plans for the free registration online event include transmission of content by four channels, 24 hours a day for 6 -almost full- days in various languages. Some of the sessions will be scheduled but we also offer plenty of open space for whoever wishes to organise their own session. In addition a "world cafe" space will be available for every participant to have informal discussions if they choose. We plan to record as many of the lectures and workshops as possible so that we stream them in a different time zone in order to give the opportunity to more people to attend them. 

Our vision:
Celebrating 100 years of Summerhill School and the inspirations A.S.Neill has given the world.
Celebrating childhood as a critical period of time for all of us and for the future of humanity.

Our mission:
To strengthen the sense of unity amongst organisations and individuals who are promoting and actively working towards positive change within education, childrearing and community.

To maximise their global impact by functioning as an incubator and accelerator of future collaborations, partnerships, alliances and movements for a more humane and sustainable future for us all.

Our values:
Our aim is to celebrate equality, children’s rights, creativity, well being, relieving pressures from childhood and embracing the values of:
Individuality. Celebrating uniqueness, self-awareness, self-regulation and self-direction.
Play. Celebrating the importance of free, pure and uninterrupted play.
Freedom not licence. Celebrating unconditional acceptance deriving from equality and the right to be oneself without infringing on other people’s freedom.
Community. Celebrating the capacity of inclusive and supportive communities to foster personal and social development, sustainability and healthy relationships towards societal change.
Emotional sincerity. Celebrating emotional honesty as an essential condition for social emotional development and a more humane world.

The fundraising campaign

To stay true to our values and principles, we are  organising our online festival to be free registration so that we give everyone the opportunity to participate. A large amount of the preparation and the realisation of our online event is based on the work of our amazing volunteers.
Still we have to cover the costs of the technical part (communication platforms, web design, technical support before, during and after the event), the promotion part and the copyright fees for the films we will be screening.
We are organising this reward based fundraising campaign to give you the opportunity to support us to make this wonderful online festival a reality, and get some lovely prizes whilst doing it. 

We are offering a variety of perks from Summerhill itself, the festival and friends, all of which contributing to support the event and to give you something lovely or a memory to treasure for your kind support. 

We chose natural and environmentally friendly materials and plastic free packages while supporting small businesses and independent young artists.

Please share our campaign far and wide even if you can't afford to support us financially. Spreading the word will give the opportunity to more people to participate. 

We thank you warmly for your support and hope to see you during both our online and in person festival. 

You can contact us at: fundraising@100yearsofsummerhill.co.uk

More info about us at:

https://summerhillfestival.com/ 

https://www.facebook.com/summerhillfestivalofch... 

https://twitter.com/SHillChildFest

https://www.instagram.com/summerhillfestival2022/ 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCOZFOf0xdWlFJ...

https://www.100yearsofsummerhill.co.uk/

story:
On behalf of our team, I would like to introduce you to 10 Modern Day Abolitionists who are striving to make a difference in the world surrounding the issue of human trafficking in Cambodia.  We are working on behalf of those caught in the injustice and painful world of sex trafficking.  We're not asking you to pack your bags and travel with us; rather we are asking you to help support our work as we travel to Cambodia October 23rd through November 7th 2014.

Members of the the Modern Day Abolitionists: Trevor, Cathy, Carol, Hillary,              Dave, Judith, Julie, Janice, Nadine and Dylan.

Let me share how we will be serving the people of Cambodia and why we hope to raise $7,500.00.  We will be working alongside four organizations, Hagar-Cambodia, Love 146, Epic Arts, and the United Methodist Missionaries to learn about their roles in rescue, recovery and legal representation for victims of human trafficking; 100% of the funds we raise will go directly to these four organizations and their continued work in Cambodia.  

Children playing in the ruins of Cambodia

Our goal in making this trip is to become better equipped  and more knowledgeable about the trafficking situation in Cambodia so that we can continue to support these groups from our community in Los Altos, California in the future. We will be meeting not only the organization leaders, but also meeting and working with those who have been rescued from trafficking and are in recovery houses.

We hope that you can see why we are passionate about supporting these organizations who work for justice in the world.  Imagine that you could be a part of this dream, giving hope to those who have lost all hope, by contributing to our work.  We aren't saying that it will be easy and that we have all the answers, because the work will be challenging, both mentally and physically.  But we know that we want to be a part of this kind of work, and we want you to be a part of it with us!  

                                                          Seek Justice

We are excited to pick up authentic "perks" in Cambodia as a thank you for our $50.00 + donors.  Know that each item we choose will be made by the people in the villages and towns that we visit and work in.  Their personal stories will be infused in each gift. We will tuck in a note about where the gift came from and, if possible, a photo of the person who created it; without a doubt, it will be a gift of great thanks.

To learn more about the organizations your contributions will support:

Hagar, Cambodia

The Methodist Missionaries, Cambodia

Glenn Miles and Love 146

Epic Arts

Other ways you can help:

  • Please share our campaign with your friends
  • Indiegogo makes sharing our campaign easy through facebook, help us spread the word.
  • Follow our journey on Facebook by "liking" our page: LAUMC Anti-Trafficking Advocates 
  • If you are in the Los Altos, California area, look us up at the United Methodist church www.laumc.org . We would be happy to meet with you and share about our trip and the continued justice work we are doing.

story:
First I thank the five first people who have supported financially the Linrec-2 project. Thank you very much! YOU are those who love mankind and the planet not in words, but in practice. And the planet won't forget you. Your names are written down here and forever!

This story is not about technology and not about energetics. This story is about freedom and about the human right to be creative.

The destiny of mankind and technical progress often depend on single Individuals – authors, inventors, odd fellows. Without these strange people the history of development would become the history of degradation. For their protection and for their stimulation people have thought up a system of patents which works and moves progress. But it does not work in all cases or in all countries.

And this story is of just such a case when this system does not work.


I am Anatolii Kharchenko, I live in Kiev, Ukraine. Due to long-term thoughts and calculations the design of the Linrec-2 fusion reactor was born by a will of providence. It differs from all existing fusion reactors radically and gives a huge hope for real fusion electrical power.

On the simple initial website http://a9414495.eu5.org/linrec/engindex.php and in other sources there is no design of the Linrec-2 reactor. It is absent because for a year now I cannot file the patent application and disclose the design of Linrec-2.

Huge problem and danger is that in Ukraine there is the article 37 of the Law of Ukraine "About protection of the rights to inventions" and the article 8 of the Law "About the state secret" which allows to make secret and to stop any economically important projects. In the case of filing a patent application in Ukraine the law requires that within three months the invention must be checked: to see whether it should be identified as a state secret or not. Such a decision is completely in the hands of bureaucrats and depends only on their personal desire. Considering the level of corruption in Ukraine and based on preliminary talks with patent agents, the invention of Linrec-2 would be made secret in Ukraine. And all this in spite of the fact that all calculations, all creative work was conducted without participation of the state, at the author’s expense and in his personal time.

It means to mankind that the invention which can completely change energetics will fall into the hands of economically backward corrupted state officials violating human rights. Whether in this case it will become available for all people or not – is a big question.

It is possible to avoid this injustice and lawlessness just now if the author files the patent application with the International patent Bureau in Geneva and will disclose the invention. It will be completely under the law and will completely correspond to the international Patent Cooperation Treaty (PCT) - http://www.wipo.int/pct/en/filing/filing.html .

If the author files the application in Geneva using PCT procedure, he will be able to disclose the invention and to make a video with an explanation of “how it works”. I am sure that this explanation will surprise all people in the world.

To prepare and to file the patent application in the International Bureau of WIPO in Geneva, to pay a duty and to make a video with an explanation, at least 3000 dollars are necessary.

Whether the Linrec-2 fusion reactor will die, having fallen into hands of the Ukrainian oligarchs and their secret police, or it will be disclosed for the world? You vote

story:
The African Refugee Development Center

The African Refugee Development Center (ARDC) is a grassroots, community-based nonprofit organization that was founded in 2004 by African asylum seekers and Israeli citizens, in order to protect, assist, and empower African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel. ARDC promotes leadership and self-sufficiency as well as advocates for a humane and fair Israeli asylum policy. To date, ARDC has served over 14,000 asylum seekers from around Africa, including Eritrea, Sudan, and Ethiopia.

ARDC has been in the forefront of media coverage this year. Check out what we have been up to!

https://www.i24news.tv/en/tv/replay/DEBRIEF/x5ypu0r

http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Making-migrants-lives-in-Israel-harder-and-harder-502653

https://www.facebook.com/mutasim.ali.7/videos/vb.100000889500631/1661526627220305/?type=3&theater

http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Activists-deem-ruling-on-migrants-deportation-bittersweet-503719

Meet the Members of ARDC

Board:

Osman Ali Kedy (Sudan) | Chairman of the Board 
Ian Jaffe (South Africa/Israel) | Board Member
Konneh Vayabatee (Liberia) | Board Member
Teklit Michael (Eritrea) | Board Member
Mola Michael (Ethiopia) | Board Member

Audit:

Mutasim Ali (Sudan) | Audit Committee
Kayla Zacher-Rotman (US/Israel) | Audit Committee

 

Staff:

Ori Lahat | Executive Director
Anda Barak | Finance Manager 
Allison Sheehan Cohen | Resource Development Manager
Rikki Chauin | PREP & CLA Program Manager
Sarah Zisser | Community Outreach Manager & Higher Education and Vocation Coordinator
Gabriel Bell  | Vocational Program Coordinator
Tesfu Bariagaber | Community Organizer & Translator
Sumia Omer | Women’s Leadership Facilitator & Translator
Yuval Bar | Sherut leumi 

About Our Projects

Practical Refugee Education Program (PREP)

Goal: To strengthen the capacity and autonomy of African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel through education, training, and professional guidance. The PREP project  focuses on enabling access to a variety of quality educational opportunities. This year alone, PREP has allowed:

  • 224 asylum seekers received individualized assistance regarding higher education options and processes;
  • 44 students have received scholarship assistance;
  • more than 80 students participated in skills-based workshops including hairdressing, carpentry, and urban farming.
  • 10 students received scholarships from ARDC;
  • 61 students received tutoring assistance in a variety of topics.

NEW: Livelihoods Program

Goal: to foster practical, skills-based opportunities as a means to improve the socioeconomic status of African asylum- seekers in Israel. UNCHR contracted ARDC to set up the new Livelihoods program in order to further heir Livelihoods strategy in Israel.  This new program aims to:

  • place up to 60 asylum seekers in market-relevant vocational training programs; and 
  • 30 asylum seekers receive aid in job placement

Community Leadership and Advocacy (CLA)

Goal: To generate change in public opinion and policy toward African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel by strengthening community leadership and engaging in advocacy, awareness raising, and dialogue with the Israeli public. In 2017, the CLA project has focused specifically on women. 

  • ARDC graduated the first cohort of women in the Leadership and Empowerment course, seeing 9 Sudanese women completing the program; and
  • Women started 2 community initiatives of their own

Advocacy is done through information sessions, tours of South Tel Aviv, media outreach, social media efforts, targeted advocacy campaigns, as well as meeting with local and international stakeholders. 

  • 166 Israelis were reached through information sessions;
  • 4 targeted social media advocacy campaigns were run using original content created by ARDC Staff and Board members.
  • 150,831 reached in targeted social media campaigns, with innumerable reached in traditional media coverage

Community Outreach and Rights Empowerment (CORE)

Goal: To promote and safeguard the rights of the community from harmful and unfair policies that stand in violation of international law. CORE supports asylum seekers through dissemination of information and training for community members regarding their legal rights of asylum, Refugee Status Determination (RSD), and Family Reunification. This year,

  • 130 asylum seekers have been trained or assisted in the Refugee Status Determination process;
  • 51 asylum seekers were personally advised on the family reunification process.
  • 1,400 asylum seekers were personally called in regards to urgent information regarding their Out Of Hand Rejection Status

Other Ways to Get Involved

If donating isn't an option, there are other ways to get involved!

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign link on your social media pages. Every share brings us closer to reaching our goal.

  • Interested in volunteering? ARDC is always grateful for the contributions of our volunteers. See our website for volunteer positions.

A huge thank you from the ARDC family!

We'd love to hear from you! Reach out to us at info@ardc-israel.org with questions, ideas, or if you are interested in getting involved!
story_txt:
The African Refugee Development Center
The African Refugee Development Center (ARDC) is a grassroots, community-based nonprofit organization that was founded in 2004 by African asylum seekers and Israeli citizens, in order to protect, assist, and empower African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel. ARDC promotes leadership and self-sufficiency as well as advocates for a humane and fair Israeli asylum policy. To date, ARDC has served over 14,000 asylum seekers from around Africa, including Eritrea, Sudan, and Ethiopia.
ARDC has been in the forefront of media coverage this year. Check out what we have been up to!

story:
Short Summary

I am a registered nurse with a passion for sustainability and empowering people to care for themselves.  In June, I will be returning to Uganda's beautiful Tororo district to work alongside and support the Rural Health Team Uganda.

Since 2010, Rotary clubs in Oregon have partnered with a non-governmental organization called Anthill Foundation to provide health projects in villages without doctors.  They have helped build a clinic, and have done many projects to improve the quality and accessibility of water, particularly in the rural Tororo district.  Since then, a strong partnership was formed and medical teams from United States go to Uganda annually to volunteer their expertise within these communities.  In June, I will be arriving as the first individual to support the newly registered Rural Health Team Uganda Organization.

The Need

There is so much need in the rural village of Tororo. I am raising funds to buy medication and medical supplies in Uganda to support this rural health clinic while contributing to the local economy.    

The Impact

As a public health nurse, my expertise is in health promotion, disease prevention and health education.  I will be supporting the local clinicians in providing health care to their community.  The villages served by the Rural Health Team Uganda have very little access to medicine and medical resources.  Your donation will enable me to buy needed medication that will help save lives and medical supplies that will help maintain the rural health clinic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lift Ugandans up with positive thoughts and loving prayers.  Ugandans are strong, smart, and capable!  Uganda is a culture where human interaction and a simple greeting is more important than an agenda.  Please spread the word and lift these clinicians up with your positive thoughts and loving prayers.

story:
Kamran Faisal Shaheed (Late) was Investigation Officer & Assistant Director of National Accountability Bureau (NAB) Pakistan. He was investigating 6 Billion Dollars Rental Power Plants Corruption Case against Prime Minister of Pakistan and 16 other Powerful Men by the order of Supreme Court of Pakistan.

He found dead in his apartment in Islamabad on 18th January 2013. Police and corrupt Government Official suddenly declared him Suicide but evidence shows that this is a clear Murder (Now it has been proved by the Forensics Laboratory that this is Murder)


Kamran Faisal Murder has become a symbol of Honesty in the Pakistan & We will fight for this cause until complete justice will be done.

 

What we want to do:

A complete and aggressive Social Media Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube & other Forum

Advertisement in Top Leading Newspapers

Organized Protests in big cities in Pakistan

Our Aim/Target,

* To inform & engage more and more Facebook & Twitter users to develop pressure on mainstream Print & Electronic Media. Our initial Target is 100000 Facebook Fans/Likes & 10000 Twitter Followers on the cause pages through Facebook & Twitter paid Advertising. (currently 22500 Fans & 3500 Followers)

* Publishing Paid Ads on the Top Urdu & English Newspapers, i.e Jang, Express, The News, Dawn etc..

* Organize powerful protest with fully organizing, i.e T-shirts with Kamran Faisal's picture, Banners, Panaflexes, Flayers, Badges 7 Brouchers will be an icing on the cake.

What we need:

* Our Initial budget to achieving all these goals within 15 days is 7500$ (Note: we can send you detailes in Personal Message box)

 

Who We Are:

We are Experts of Social Media & Print Media Experts from Islamabad Pakistan also the Admin/Manager of Justice For Kamran Faisal Cause pages on Facebook & Twitter.

www.facebook.com/JusticeForKamranFaisal

www.Twitter.com/Justice4Kamran

www.youtube.com/watch?v=akJw57FaGCc

We are working on this cause on No Profit No Loss basis (and will ever).

We are not Family Members, Relatives, Fellows, Colleagues of Late Kamran Faisal Shaheed. (This is an independent Civil Society Struggles like Judges Restorations struggles)

 

Our Accountability:

We will be responsible for each single cent/penny/Rupees.

We will be answerable to each Donator/Member.

We will share each and every expenses details with donators (with Bills, Invoices, Transactions, Evidences, Images, Videos etc..)

 

 

 

News: http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-13-20946-Forensic-report-says-Kamran-Faisal-was-tortured-before-death

story:
Short Summary

Schaeffer Cox, 29, is a husband and father of two young children. He is a political activist. In 2008, Cox ran for the Alaska House of Representatives. His platform was simple:

  • The government needs to follow the Constitution because it's the law.
Cox argued that when the government disregards the law and tramples on others, simply because they are powerful enough to do so and get away with it, it hurts them as a Nation. He went on to point out that that sort of heavy handed disregard for their basic obligations costs the government their stability at home and their credibility abroad. His message was well received by the people and local government. After the election, Schaeffer Cox spent time traveling and gave speeches outlying a peaceful way to reclaim individual liberty. His message continued to warn the people attending his speeches that the Federal Government's current behavior was unsustainable. He contended, that the responsibility would fall back on to the shoulders of the people who had created the  Government and let it run off its rails.As Schaeffer Cox continued to give speeches, the crowds grew. This caught the attention of the Federal Government. Cox now had the world's most powerful government as an enemy. For the next several months, Cox and his family now had the force of the Federal Government against them. The FBI played a key role in trying to provoke Cox and when those attempts failed, the FBI began tearing apart the family.

What turned out to be a nightmare, continues. Schaeffer Cox is currently serving a 26 year sentence. The charges the Federal Government came up with range from conspiracy to murder federal workers to weapons charges. He is being held in a communications management unit (CMU, also known as Little Guantanamo) in Marion, IL.

Schaeffer Cox is an example of the tyrannical grip the Federal Government has on the people and their thoughts. There is no injured party; there was no crime. At what point has the overreaching grip of the Federal Government gone too far? If someone does not think the way the Federal Government wants them to or challenges the policies, the person is considered a threat.

Thank you for your generous contribution and your support!

What Is Needed

  • The immediate need of $20,000 will pay part of the outstanding attorney fees totaling $34,000.
  • Funds raised in excess of $20,000 will be applied to the remaining outstanding balance.
  • Funds raised above $34,000 will be be used to at the family's discretion during the appeal process.

The Impact

The importance of this case is critical for the whole of humanity. When a government decides what we can eat, what we must buy and what we are allowed to think, we no longer have life. Thomas Jefferson wrote:

  • "To preserve the freedom of the human mind... and freedom of the press, every spirit should be ready to devote itself to martyrdom; for as long as we may think as we will and speak as we think, the condition of man will proceed in improvement." Thomas Jefferson to William Green Munford, 1799

Martin Niemöller (1892-1984) was a prominent Protestant pastor who emerged as an outspoken public foe of Adolf Hitler and spent the last seven years of Nazi rule in concentration camps, despite his eager support of nationalism. He is best known for the following statement:

  • "First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out-- Because I was not a Socialist. Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out-- Because I was not a Trade Unionist.Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out-- Because I was not a Jew. Then they came for me--and there was no one left to speak for me." ~ Martin Niemöller

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize not everyone can contribute financially. Here's what you can do to help:

  • Share this campaign often amongst your friends, family and groups you belong to. The Indiegogo platform makes it simple to share on social media platforms. 
  • Become familiar with how you can take back your individual liberty by viewing the speech Schaeffer Cox delivered to a group in Hamilton, MT: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6iWqTEWB-aM

story:
Short Summary

Nathan Brown and Katy Graham here...gearing up to climb Mt. Kilimanjaro, the tallest free standing mountain in the world, in just a few short weeks. Our purpose? To raise funds to feed some Congolese refugees who have recently been displaced to Uganda due to rebel groups taking over their homes and villages.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to use 100% of what is raised to purchase as many tons of maize and beans to feed as many people as possible.

Every dollar amount helps and will make a difference in sustaining lives, but we are offering 'thank you' gifts for 3 levels of giving:

  • $25 = Feeds 12 people for a week and we'll send you a Kilimanjaro postcard from Tanzania.
  • $100 = Feeds 50 people for a week and we'll send you a postcard and an authentic African souvenir.
  • $250 = Feeds 125 for a week and as a thank you, we'll send you a postcard, a souvenir, and record a personalized video greeting from the top of the mountain.
If we don't hit our fundraising goal, we still keep and use every dollar to feed these people. If we exceed our goal, more people will be fed!

The Impact

By partnering with us, you are helping to keep alive these Congolese refugees who are in desperate need of food right now, along with supporting our efforts to find a longer term sustainable solution.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word and raise awareness by sharing with your friends and networks. THANK YOU!

story:
First of all: I'm assuming this will mostly be read by Icelanders and by those who already are well aware of who I am and what I do. So the text below is in Icelandic. But don't hesitate to look me up on Facebook or Twitter if you want to talk! Also, my gmail is hildur.lilliendahl. In case someone foreign and Hildur-curious should stumble upon this, I'll post some links to news about me in English below all that Icelandic bullcrap.

Just to explain a tiny bit in English: I am Hildur Lilliendahl Viggósdóttir. An Icelandic feminist activist. I've been promoting women's rights like crazy online and in the media for the past couple of years and throughout that time I think it's safe to say I've been the most outspoken and most talked about feminist activist in Iceland. I've received honors from the Icelandic offices of UN Women as well as from Stígamót, the leading Icelandic counseling and information center for survivors of sexual abuse and violence. In 2012 I was voted Hero of the Year by the readers of Icelandic newspaper DV.

In June 2014 a huge Nordic Women's Rights conference will be held in Malmö, Sweden. More on that here. I really really want to go. I have to go. Seriously. I'm going to need a bit of extra cash to make this happen, at least somewhere in the surroundings of 7-800 EUR. The total cost of the trip should be around double that amount, but I'm looking into different ways to fund the trip. 

Það helsta

Ég er Hildur, femínískur aktívisti sem heldur úti bloggsíðunni Karlar sem hata konur. Á undanförnum tveimur árum hefur mér tekist, allt að því óvart, að taka talsvert mikið pláss í opinberri umræðu um jafnrétti kynjanna, ágalla á því og leiðir til að ná því. Ég hef ekki aðgang að neinum drjúgum sjóðum, hef engin fjárhagslega sjálfstæð samtök á bakvið mig og hef háð mína baráttu þessi tvö ár í sjálfboðavinnu.

Ég þrái að komast á Nordiskt Forum í Malmö í sumar. Nordiskt Forum er sameiginleg risastór ráðstefna kvennahreyfinga Norðurlandanna. Hún var síðast haldin í Turku 1994 og þar á undan í Osló 1988. Þá mættu þúsund konur frá Íslandi, merkileg tengslamyndun og merkileg menntun átti sér stað. Svona samkomur geta breytt landslaginu. Mig langar að taka þátt í því og ég bið um þína aðstoð til að svo megi verða. 

Miðaverð á ráðstefnuna hækkar eftir 21. mars. Ég stefni að því að vera búin að tryggja mér miða fyrir þann tíma. 

Hvað mig vantar og hvað þú færð

Ef þú styrkir mig til þátttöku í Nordiskt Forum færðu að sjálfsögðu kveðju tilbaka frá mér. Eðli þeirra kveðja fer eftir upphæð styrksins. Þú getur fengið mention og koss á Facebook, þú getur fengið póstkort frá Malmö, þú gætir fengið sérvalda gjöf frá Malmö og ef þú ert í fáránlega gjafmildu skapi færðu mig sjálfa heim til þín (mögulega ásamt vel völdum aðstoðarmanni) að laga kaffi og baka brauð.

Heildarkostnaður þessa ferðalags verður aldrei langt undir 200.000 krónum. Flugmiðinn hangir röngumegin við 50K, hótelgisting daðrar við 100K, miðinn á ráðstefnuna kostar um 15K og eitthvað verður kona nú að borða. Ég er að safna pening sjálf og er líka að sanka að mér hugmyndum um mögulegar styrkveitingar. Ég er að gera mér vonir um að fá frábæra stuðningsfólkið mitt til að hjálpa mér með helminginn af kostnaðinum. Ég hef fulla trú á að það muni takast með einum eða öðrum hætti.

Stillingin á þessum reikningi er flexible funding, sem þýðir að ég þarf ekki nauðsynlega að ná markmiði mínu til að þeir peningar sem safnast renni til mín. Það er einfaldlega vegna þess að ég hef stuttan tíma til stefnu þar til miðaverðið á ráðstefnuna hækkar en það er ekki endanlegt deadline til að taka ákvörðun um hvort ég fer. Ég mun því halda áfram að safna eins og óð kona að þessum skamma tíma liðnum þrátt fyrir að ég nái ekki markmiðinu í gegnum þessa síðu.

Áhrifin

Ég trúi því að barátta mín sé til gagns fyrir íslenskt samfélag. Ég trúi því að það sé gott fyrir íslenskan femínisma (og þar með vitanlega íslenskt samfélag) að ég, sem einhver herskáasti og mest áberandi og umtalaði femímisti landsins, kynni mér strauma og stefnur á öðrum Norðurlöndum, myndi og styrki tengsl og mennti mig í aktívisma. Ef þú trúir því líka óska ég eftir því að þú hjálpir mér að vera memm í Nordiskt Forum. Ef ekki, þá er það vitanlega í fínu lagi og fullt af öðrum sniðugum málum til að leggja lið á internetinu.

En hvað ef þú átt ekki pening?

Það er sko allt í lagi. En þá langar mig líka að biðja þig að spá í hvort þú þekkir einhvern annan sem gæti viljað hjálpa. Hvað er að frétta af helfemínísku frænku þinni vestur á Hólmavík sem veit eeeekkert hvað hún á að gera við alla peningana sína? 

Eða langar þig kannski að senda mér bréf? Netfangið mitt er hildur og svo punktur og svo lilliendahl og svo hjá gmail. En passaðu samt að stafa lilliendahl rétt.

***VIÐBÓT***

Þetta fer rosalega vel af stað, ástarþakkir fyrir mig! Eitthvað hefur borið á því að fólk nenni ekki eða kunni ekki að styrkja mig eftir þeim leiðum sem hér eru í boði. Ég var þess vegna beðin að bæta inn reikningsupplýsingum. Þær eru þessar:

Rkn. 0515-26-150781
Kt. 150781-4269.

Aaaaand, finally. Links to stuff about me in English, as promised above:

Dr. Perri Campbell, Deakin University, AU, on my activism and the Facebook controversy.

Haukur S. Magnússon, The Reykjavík Grapevine, an editorial about my blog, Men who hate women.

Júlíana Björnsdóttir, Iceland Review, on my blog, Men who hate women.

Parker Yamasaki, The Reykjavík Grapevine, on activism surrounding Miss Iceland.

Mark O'Brien, The Daily Telegraph, interview.

Emma Barnett, The Daily Telegraph, on Facebook banning me.
story_txt:
First of all: I'm assuming this will mostly be read by Icelanders and by those who already are well aware of who I am and what I do. So the text below is in Icelandic. But don't hesitate to look me up on Facebook or Twitter if you want to talk! Also, my gmail is hildur.lilliendahl. In case someone foreign and Hildur-curious should stumble upon this, I'll post some links to news about me in English below all that Icelandic bullcrap.Just to explain a tiny bit in English: I am Hildur Lilliendahl Viggósdóttir. An Icelandic feminist activist. I've been promoting women's rights like crazy online and in the media for the past couple of years and throughout that time I think it's safe to say I've been the most outspoken and most talked about feminist activist in Iceland. I've received honors from the Icelandic offices of UN Women as well as from Stígamót, the leading Icelandic counseling and information center for survivors of sexual abuse and violence. In 2012 I was voted Hero of the Year by the readers of Icelandic newspaper DV.In June 2014 a huge Nordic Women's Rights conference will be held in Malmö, Sweden. More on that here. I really really want to go. I have to go. Seriously. I'm going to need a bit of extra cash to make this happen, at least somewhere in the surroundings of 7-800 EUR. The total cost of the trip should be around double that amount, but I'm looking into different ways to fund the trip. 
Það helsta
Ég er Hildur, femínískur aktívisti sem heldur úti bloggsíðunni Karlar sem hata konur. Á undanförnum tveimur árum hefur mér tekist, allt að því óvart, að taka talsvert mikið pláss í opinberri umræðu um jafnrétti kynjanna, ágalla á því og leiðir til að ná því. Ég hef ekki aðgang að neinum drjúgum sjóðum, hef engin fjárhagslega sjálfstæð samtök á bakvið mig og hef háð mína baráttu þessi tvö ár í sjálfboðavinnu.Ég þrái að komast á Nordiskt Forum í Malmö í sumar. Nordiskt Forum er sameiginleg risastór ráðstefna kvennahreyfinga Norðurlandanna. Hún var síðast haldin í Turku 1994 og þar á undan í Osló 1988. Þá mættu þúsund konur frá Íslandi, merkileg tengslamyndun og merkileg menntun átti sér stað. Svona samkomur geta breytt landslaginu. Mig langar að taka þátt í því og ég bið um þína aðstoð til að svo megi verða. Miðaverð á ráðstefnuna hækkar eftir 21. mars. Ég stefni að því að vera búin að tryggja mér miða fyrir þann tíma. Hvað mig vantar og hvað þú færðEf þú styrkir mig til þátttöku í Nordiskt Forum færðu að sjálfsögðu kveðju tilbaka frá mér. Eðli þeirra kveðja fer eftir upphæð styrksins. Þú getur fengið mention og koss á Facebook, þú getur fengið póstkort frá Malmö, þú gætir fengið sérvalda gjöf frá Malmö og ef þú ert í fáránlega gjafmildu skapi færðu mig sjálfa heim til þín (mögulega ásamt vel völdum aðstoðarmanni) að laga kaffi og baka brauð.Heildarkostnaður þessa ferðalags verður aldrei langt undir 200.000 krónum. Flugmiðinn hangir röngumegin við 50K, hótelgisting daðrar við 100K, miðinn á ráðstefnuna kostar um 15K og eitthvað verður kona nú að borða. Ég er að safna pening sjálf og er líka að sanka að mér hugmyndum um mögulegar styrkveitingar. Ég er að gera mér vonir um að fá frábæra stuðningsfólkið mitt til að hjálpa mér með helminginn af kostnaðinum. Ég hef fulla trú á að það muni takast með einum eða öðrum hætti.Stillingin á þessum reikningi er flexible funding, sem þýðir að ég þarf ekki nauðsynlega að ná markmiði mínu til að þeir peningar sem safnast renni til mín. Það er einfaldlega vegna þess að ég hef stuttan tíma til stefnu þar til miðaverðið á ráðstefnuna hækkar en það er ekki endanlegt deadline til að taka ákvörðun um hvort ég fer. Ég mun því halda áfram að safna eins og óð kona að þessum skamma tíma liðnum þrátt fyrir að ég nái ekki markmiðinu í gegnum þessa síðu.ÁhrifinÉg trúi því að barátta mín sé til gagns fyrir íslenskt samfélag. Ég trúi því að það sé gott fyrir íslenskan femínisma (og þar með vitanlega íslenskt samfélag) að ég, sem einhver herskáasti og mest áberandi og umtalaði femímisti landsins, kynni mér strauma og stefnur á öðrum Norðurlöndum, myndi og styrki tengsl og mennti mig í aktívisma.
